events.name: How AI Impacting B2B Ad Strategies & Tactics
events.description: Join us for an insightful panel discussion on how AI is powering today's digital advertising across many platforms-from Google & LinkedIn to more niche B2B ad platforms. You'll learn practical strategies to adapt to these changes, optimize your campaigns, & stay ahead of the competition. The panel discussion will address: AI's role in digital advertising Key AI-powered tools for B2B marketers How to leverage AI for better targeting & segmentation Best practices for integrating AI into your campaign strategies to achieve measurable results Whether you're just starting to explore AI or looking to take your current campaigns to the next level, this event will equip you with the knowledge & tactics to thrive in the AI-powered future of B2B marketing. Stick around after the panel to connect with peers, exchange insights, & enjoy drinks & appetizers at our happy hour. Your Speakers: Kevin Lord Barry, Co-Founder, Right Percent Jacob Orbach-Smith, Growth Marketing Lead,Headway Ahmad Sahli, Performance Marketing, Gusto Who should attend? B2B marketers, advertising professionals, growth marketing leaders, & anyone looking to gain a competitive edge in today's AI-driven landscape. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Trends & Tech In The Supply Chain
events.description: Join SAP for a conversation with leading supply chain & business journalists during New York Tech Week.  From tariffs & product shortages to the rise of AI & automated logistics, supply chains are making headlines  & reshaping the future of business. This exclusive event will explore the trends, technologies & tensions shaping global operations today, & what it means for companies across industries, especially those innovating in New Yorks dynamic tech & commerce landscape.  Moderated by Val Blatt, SAPs Chief Revenue Officer of Supply Chain Management, the panel will feature the top journalists driving the coverage  whats coming next, whats keeping supply chain leaders up at night, & how the stories get told. This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Uniting For Impact - Tech & AI For US
events.description: UNITING FOR IMPACT: Tech & AI for Public Health #NYTechWeek   CUNY SPH & KPMG US Mobilizing Startups, Government, Funders, & Industry to Solve America's Growing Public Health Crises with Technology & AI-Driven Solutions   UNITING FOR IMPACT is a networking event during NYC Tech Week co-hosted by KPMG US & Firefly Innovations, the nation's leading public health entrepreneurship platform at the top-ranked CUNY Graduate School of Public Health.   Over cocktails & hors d'oeuvres, this gathering convenes leaders across government, capital, industry, & innovation to confront America's escalating public health crises through technology, AI, & startup-driven solutions.   The event will spotlight the powerful partnership between Firefly Innovations & professional services firm KPMG US - an alliance that is driving record growth in the annual CUNY Public Health Innovation Accelerator program while expanding its reach & national impact.    Together, they are accelerating public health innovation to confront America's growing public health crises with bold, scalable solutions.   Join a community committed to building a healthier, more resilient nation - while advancing economic growth & strengthening the public health workforce through tech-driven innovation.   Learn more at Firefly-Innovations.org   This event is a part of #NYTechWeek - a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem.    Learn more at www.tech-week.com

events.name: Expanding Inclusion To Drive Economic  Growth
events.description: Panel & Networking Reception: Tech & Finance's Role in Expanding Inclusion to Drive Economic Growth APCO is organizing a gathering in New York City on June 3! In this panel, representatives from the technology, financial, & public policy sectors will explore the critical role of major technology companies & leading financial institutions in bridging the digital & financial literacy divide, particularly in emerging economies. Confirmed panelists include: Graham Macmillan, President, Visa Foundation Amee Parbhoo, Managing Partner, Accion Venture Lab, Accion Andrew Rasiej, Founder, Civic Hall @ Union Square; Chairman of the Board, NY Tech Alliance Rebekah Tweed, Executive Director, All Tech Is Human The discussion will highlight how these efforts benefit local communities, drive economic growth, & connect more consumers, entrepreneurs, & SMEs to the digital economy. By addressing key initiatives, barriers, & opportunities, we will demonstrate that "doing good" benefits the entire ecosystem by fueling financial growth. Please join APCO for an engaging discussion! **Light bites & drinks will be available.**  ### APCO is a global advisory & advocacy firm helping clients navigate a complex world & create lasting impact. As trusted & strategic advisers, consultants & creators to some of the world's leading corporations, foundations & governments, we discover & foster valuable connections, insights & solutions that drive our clients' missions & objectives forward. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com

events.name: Brooklyn Tech Expo
events.description: Agenda10:00 AM - 4:00 PM Exhibitor Floor + General Networking + Free Professional Headshots 10:15 AM - 4:00 PM SEMINARS ON VARIOUS AI & TECH TOPICS The Future of AI in the Workplace; AI for Startups & Entrepreneurs; AI & Automation: Friend or Foe? Building Smarter Businesses with AI; AI-Powered Marketing & Sales.About this eventThe Annual BROOKLYN TECH EXPO - our flagship event & Brooklyn's largest tech conference, returns on June 3, 2025, in the heart of Dumbo, Brooklyn, organized by Pulse NYC. This high-energy expo focuses on AI & cutting-edge technology, bringing together Brooklyn's thriving tech & business communities for a day of innovation, networking, & learning. This event is a part of NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. If your company is interested in sponsoring or exhibiting at the expo, please contact us for details. This presents an excellent opportunity for your business to network, gain visibility, & access the untapped Brooklyn tech market. With an anticipated attendance of over 1,000 professionals - including C-level executives, founders, business owners, & industry leaders - attendees will have the opportunity to engage with innovative companies & exhibitors showcasing impactful tech solutions. events.name: AI In Space - Exploring Future Of Data, Discovery & Design
events.description: A Space Apps NYC 2025 Preview Event Join us for a dynamic, multi-speaker session previewing Space Apps NYC 2025-where curiosity meets code & cosmic questions become collaborative experiments. This event brings together NASA datasets, AI-powered workflows, & mind-expanding applications of space science. Hear from: Cloudflare on how AI is reshaping coding workflows & developer productivity Steven Jaret (AMNH) on decoding the story of our solar system through meteorite research Michael Caprio (Tesla Science Center) on Open Space, a 3D platform visualizing real NASA mission data And more voices exploring how open data & public science can fuel both education & innovation Whether you're a student, scientist, coder, or community builder-this is your launchpad to get involved, get inspired, & get ready for this year's Space Apps challenge. In an age of AI & institutional uncertainty, the next generation of civic & tech leaders needs more than just skills-they need to practice working across silos, building with clarity, & designing for meaning. That's what Space Apps + SWARM is. Not just a hackathon. A year-long civic sandbox for: students to grow orgs to connect problems to get visible systems to be made legible and life to improve on Earth & in space Pizza & light refreshments will be served. Community Partners:

events.name: Growth Mindset Founders Breakfast
events.description: This NY Tech Week, take a breath. A-Players is hosting an intimate morning gathering for Series A-stage founders & investors, featuring a guided mindfulness session led by Irka Ryabaya (ex-Goldman Sachs), a mental health coach & former founder herself.  You'll reflect on your journey, connect with peers through thoughtful dialogue, & enjoy a curated breakfast with others who understand the highs & lows of scaling a startup. With a network of 650+ founders & partnerships with top VCs, A-Players creates highly curated, private events designed to foster real connections & shared growth. We are proud to partner with Stifel Venture Bank & TriNet for this event. Stifel Financial (NYSE: SF) is a global investment bank, wealth management, & commercial banking institution with $400B+ in AUM. Stifel Bank offers venture & fund banking solutions, including 100% free banking for fund clients, fully insured liquid ICS accounts (up to $250MM FDIC coverage), capital call & management company lines of credit, & venture lending. Learn more at https://bankwithstifel.com/venture-banking/ Raising money from investors requires you to show you can run a business. You need a full-service HR solution tailored for growing technology companies. With decades of experience & roots in Silicon Valley, TriNet provides HR expertise to help you grow your company & stay compliant. By working with them, you can focus on what's important-raising capital, launching innovative solutions & scaling your team. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.description: The VC secondary market is booming... ...but what does that mean for founders? "Founder Secondaries: The Why's, When's, & How's" will help founders explore when they should 'take chips off the table' regarding shares on their path to IPO or Exit. (Please note that this is an exclusive event for Series B & beyond, venture-backed founding teams.) In this fireside chat, we will cover:+ Different kinds of venture secondary transactions;+ Who founders could partner with in those transactions (and the pros/cons of each type);+ How much is 'too much' to sell;+ What to 'watch out for'; and+ How to make sure you're managing your personal wealth in the process. Our fireside chat will feature Corient (corient.com) & Altra Venture Partners (altravp.com) in Corient's beautiful Midtown Manhattan offices... just wait until you see the view! Adam Katz & Jonathan Hochberg, leaders of Corient's Founder & Entrepreneur practice, will be in discussion with Jamie Melzer, the Founder & Managing Partner of Altra. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com

events.name: Gam3 On - Chelsea Teste Launch For Soneium
events.description: Gam3 On: Chelsea Testnet Launch for Soneium's Gaming L3  Join us at New York Tech Week, on June 4th, 2-4 PM as we unveil Chelsea, the testnet launch of our groundbreaking Gaming L3 on Soneium. This marks a major milestone for the future of onchain gaming - designed for performance, scale, & seamless developer experience. This exclusive event will be split into two power-packed sessions followed by networking & mingling.  Part 1: Technical Panel (2:00 - 2:30 PM) Diving into Web3 Gaming Infrastructure & Chelsea Testnet Hear from leading builders & researchers on the next evolution of gaming blockchains, & how Chelsea sets the stage for what's next.  Part 2: Investor Panel (2:30 - 3:00 PM) Funding Web3 Gaming: Round 2 A candid discussion with top investors on where capital is flowing, what's changed in gaming VC, & what's now in the spotlight.  Networking (3:00 - 4:00 PM) Meet fellow founders, devs, investors, & ecosystem builders. Drinks, alpha, & Chelsea testnet invites await. discussions about the latest trends in blockchain technology & explore the future of gaming. Every conversation could ignite the next groundbreaking idea-don't miss out on this exclusive opportunity to network. This event is proudly sponsored by a16z & WeWork. We extend our sincere thanks for their generous support. About Blockus Blockus is your all in one platform for Web3 gaming, enabling game studios to build fast, reduce costs & laser focus on gameplay.  Blockus provides seamlessly integrated Wallet-as-a-service account + wallet management, first party NFT marketplace, & fiat + crypto payments.  website | Twitter | LinkedIn About Soneium Soneium, an Ethereum layer-2 developed by Sony Block Solutions Labs, is a versatile general-purpose blockchain platform that aims to evoke emotion, empower creativity, & realize the open internet that transcends boundaries. By transcending cultural differences & bringing together people with diverse values, Soneium reimagines how we interact with the internet, opening up a world of innovative applications that fill the world with emotion. Website | X | Discord | Telegram This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Infrastructure In Focus - Postgresql Modernization On Azure
events.description: As businesses strive to deliver seamless digital experiences, the demand for databases that combine speed, resilience, & simplicity has never been higher. Azure Database for PostgreSQL is purpose-built to meet these expectations, offering a fully managed, open-source solution with dynamic scaling, zone-redundant high availability, & advanced performance tuning. Whether you're migrating legacy systems or building new applications, Azure's intelligent automation & enterprise security help you stay ahead of the curve-so you can focus on what matters most: driving business value & delighting your users. Discover with Quadrant Technologies, Microsoft, & AMD how Azure's powerful platform can streamline & secure your PostgreSQL databases, no matter where they run-on-premises, in multi-cloud setups, or at the edge.

events.name: Data, Design & New Era Of Women's Longevity
events.description: Behind every health stat is a lived story-and for women, those stories have been ignored & poorly understood for too long. But that's changing. Join us for a conversation about how data, design, & a new generation of women-led innovation are bringing visibility, intelligence, & continuity to women's health. Join us for a fireside chat featuring three women deeply immersed in reimagining care: - Dr Estelle Giraud, PhD co-founder & CEO of Trellis Health, building the infrastructure for generational health- Dr. Hillary Lin, a physician-entrepreneur & cofounder of elevateX, elevating healthcare via AI-enabled precision longevity- Naseem Sayani, investor at How Women Invest & previously founding partner at Emmeline Ventures, backing the startups reshaping women's lived experience through health, finance, & family systems. Together, they'll unpack the new science of women's health, the emerging companies & trends in venture investment across the category, & the growing business models & access points for consumers. We'll explore the new tools helping women understand their bodies- from biomarkers to blueprints, & the care models that reflect the way we actually live. If you building in or are curious about women's health, if you believe longevity should be intelligent & inclusive, if you're ready to see what happens when data meets design with empathy-this is the room to be in. This isn't your mom's healthcare system anymore. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com

events.name: NJ Fast Expo
events.description: Join us for our NJ FAST Expo. More details to come! Startups Pitches Listed Below: Squirro turns meaningless data into A.I.-driven actionable Insights. Venteur is an AI-powered benefits marketplace that empowers individuals to take control of their health care. DeepKeep multimodal AI security safeguards machine learning pipelines, promoting secure, unbiased, real time & trustworthy AI solutions. Penelope is a self-service retirement platform for small & micro businesses. Vaultik is the bank for your belongings that unlocks a new world of post sale opportunities including perks, insurance, & credit services for high net worth individuals. Markets EQ provides GenAI solution providing competitive tonal analysis, previously unavailable awareness. Cranium is an AI security & trust platform that delivers security & trust to the AI revolution. Ledge is a command center for payments built for finance teams operating at scale. Column is an AI-powered insurance management platform designed for today's financial professionals. Clarista is a data analytics platform that provides real-time answers from any enterprise platform, acting as a bridge between technical data & AI. OpenVC provides investible unicorn indexes of the most innovative late-stage venture capital companies.  AQ22 is a loan assessment AI solution built exclusively for credit analysts. Our platform boosts loan assessment efficiency, accuracy, & transparency for creditors, credit unions, & alternative lenders.  Indemn builds machine learning-powered insurance conversations. Users can learn about coverage, purchase insurance, & perform service tasks through natural conversation. FinX Capital Markets builds high-performance systems for investors, analysts, & risk managers of capital markets. Kobalt Labs is an AI-powered platform to reduce errors & increase efficiency in manual compliance work. Atidot empowers life insurance & annuity writers to evaluate opportunities in the in-force of business with big data & predictive analytics. Truthifi is a developer of a wealth management platform designed to offer financial advisory services. #NJFAST #Innovation #NextGenStartups #Networking #GameChangers #NewJersey #Startups #Accelerator

We'll explore how their businesses prioritize community-building & share real tactics for community-led growth. Our speakers: Avital Knoller of Wiz (wiz.io) EJ White of beehiiv (beehiiv.com) Peter Kang of Clay (clay.com) Your hosts: Tightknit, the community platform built for B2B SaaS (tightknit.ai) Fabrik, an NYC place to belong (joinfabrik.com) As this event has limited space, we will prioritize founders, community managers, customer support leaders, & customer marketers. events.name: Future Of Investing In Robotics - Perspectives From Founders & Funders
events.description: Join a panel of robotics investors & founders during NY Tech Week for a lively lunchtime conversation, navigating The Future of Investing in Robotics, an eye-opening conversation that cuts through the noise surrounding the robotics investment landscape. With robotics rapidly emerging as a driving force in industries from healthcare to manufacturing, the question is no longer if robotics will transform our world, but how & when investors can expect real returns. This session will provide an in-depth look at the opportunities & challenges of investing in the robotics sector, focusing on the technologies that are truly reshaping industries, from hardware breakthroughs to AI-driven automation. Our panel of industry leaders, investors, & technologists will offer valuable insights into the practicalities of funding robotics ventures & what it takes to succeed in a market that is as fast-paced as it is complex. Key topics include:  The current state of robotics innovation: What's working & what's still a vision? Identifying high-potential robotics startups & technologies with real-world applications The financial landscape of robotics: Navigating risk, scaling challenges, & market readiness Trends in AI, machine learning, & automation that are driving the next wave of robotics investments Overcoming the hype: Separating the promises from the practical realities of robotics Whether you're a seasoned investor, a robotics entrepreneur, or simply curious about the future of this transformative technology, this event will give you the tools to make informed decisions about where & how to invest in the robotics revolution. RSVP today & be part of the conversation at the forefront of robotics innovation during NY Tech Week. Lunch & refreshments will be served. Hosted by New York Robotics Network, Interwoven Ventures, Teradyne Robotics Ventures & EisnerAmper. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: ETP Forum
events.description: In its 13th year, the expanded ETP Forum combines the brightest minds in Investment Management & Exchange-Traded Products in front of a highly sophisticated audience of Financial Professionals. This 1-day conference blends Asset Owners, Asset Managers, Family Offices, Endowments, Foundations & Wealth Management to create the most powerful audience in the ETP industry. Our 5-star speaking faculty will provide first-hand insight as they take a deep dive into the most cutting-edge topics. Come gain insight & network with leaders in the ETP industry at this leading event. Potential Topics Include: Legends of InvestingArtificial IntelligenceCryptocurrenciesDefined Outcome ETFsETF TradingActively Managed ETFsFixed Income Strategies for TodayNew-to-Market ETF RoundtableThe Future of IndexingThe Evolving Legal & Compliance EnvironmentBest Opportunities for 2025 Please note that complimentary registration for the Top Wealth Advisors & Asset Owners categories are only open to certain professional profiles. If you are a service provider & would like to attend, please register under the appropriate category via one of the paid tickets or inquire regarding sponsorship opportunities. Please be advised that photography & film will be taken during the program for promotional use. By registering for this event, you consent to the use of your image within future promotional materials as well as opt-in to all future promotional & other correspondence from The ETP Forum (including event Sponsors & Supporters), The Expert Series & ETF Global. The Expert Series reserves the right, at any time & in its sole discretion, to reject, not approve, cancel or withdraw any registration at any stage for any reason. The Expert Series reserves the right to reject any registrations for any reason including registrations that in any way contravene the laws of any state or country in which this event occurrs. Chatham House RuleThis conference, or part thereof, is held under the Chatham House Rule. Conference participants are free to use the information received, but neither the identity nor the affiliation of the speaker(s), nor that of any other participant, may be revealed. By registering for this event, attending individual(s) represents that they & their firm agree to abide by the above condition. FAQs Do you accept walk-ins? Unfortunately, we cannot accept walk-ins. All attendees must be registered via this site as of 3:00 PM ET the day before the event.   What is the Dress Code for the event? The dress code for this event is Business Casual Attire. Additionally, the NYAC has their own minimum standard for attire. New York Athletic Club Dress Code: Men: Jackets are optional. Slacks, a collared shirt & dress shoes are permitted. Jeans, T-shirts & Sneakers remain prohibited.Women: Relaxed, comparable attire (skirt or slacks with blouse). Jeans, T-shirts, Leggings & Sneakers remain prohibited. Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? fxhagan@expertseries.org Is my registration/ticket transferrable? Yes - please just email us to let us know at fxhagan@expertseries.org Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? No - if you have registered, we will be expecting you Is there a Refund Policy? If you are unable to attend the event for any reason, we will provide you a full credit for any future ETP Forum. What will be the COVID protocols? There are currently no COVID restrictions in place for this event.

events.name: Future Of AI In Fashion & Ecommerce
events.description: AI is rapidly changing how fashion brands deliver experiences & personalization at scale. From AI-generated photoshoots to design prototyping & hyper-personalized marketing, the future is here-and it's accelerating fast. Join us for an exclusive NY Tech Week event in SoHo hosted by ImagineCreate AI & Shopify, featuring a panel with leaders from Fashion, AI, Ad-Tech, & Commerce. We're bringing together fashion brands & tech leaders to explore how AI is helping accelerate product launches, test creatives, deliver personalized content, & increase conversions at scale. What you can expect:- A panel discussion with Fatima Yusuf, Founder of ImagineCreate AI, Brennan Loh, Director of Brand at Shopify, Meagan Martino, Director of Ecommerce at AppLovin, & more to be announced.- Live AI fashion photography & video demos powered by imaginecreate.ai- Lunch & networking with fashion & tech innovators Fashion brands, DTC builders, creative marketers - this event is for you. RSVP today - space is limited. ----ImagineCreate AI is an image & video generation platform built for fashion & e-commerce brands. Learn more at imaginecreate.ai Shopify NY is the hub for NYC's most innovative entrepreneurs, creators, & brands building on Shopify-supporting community, commerce, & creativity at every stage. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: MetaProp Accelerator Demo Day
events.description: Join us in NYC for MetaProp's 2025 Demo Day on June 17th. Be among the first to meet the next generation of PropTech innovators as the six startups in MetaProp's latest Accelerator cohort take the stage. This exclusive event brings together top investors, industry leaders, & select media to hear firsthand from visionary founders tackling the real estate industry's most pressing challenges. June 17, 20259:00 AM - 12:00 PM ESTMidtown Manhattan (RSVP for address) If you have any questions, please get in touch with Evan Petitt at epetitt@metaprop.com. This marquee event has limited space & fills up fast every year. 2025 Cohort BUILDRFI (Miami) - BuildrFi streamlines financial workflows for construction by offering a clear view of project cash flows & financing options, helping to manage material costs & delayed payments. FRAM ENERGY (NYC) - Fram Energy makes solar deployment for multifamily & single-family rentals profitable & effortless through tenant energy billing software. POPWHEELS (NYC) - PopWheels is revolutionizing urban mobility in America with its e-bike battery swap network, starting with the 80,000+ delivery workers in NYC. PROPRISE (SF) - PropRise is an AI-driven commercial real estate deal sourcing platform, transforming how firms discover & evaluate opportunities. ULAMA (NYC) - Ulama is AI-powered code compliance that automates the approval of construction permit applications. WEALTHIE (NYC) - Wealthie builds more wealth for homeowners by investing home equity in diversified assets without loans or debt.

events.name: Influence & Advocacy For Engg Leaders
events.description: Join our Engineering Leadership NYC event, in collaboration with LinkedIn, focused on discussing the experiences of women engineering leaders. We're welcoming all engineering leaders to be part of the audience. This event will explore how engineering leaders can expand their impact by fostering relationships, advocating for themselves & others, & driving meaningful change across teams & organizations. The topic will dive deep into: 1. How to foster influence through relationships & trust, cultivating allies & making your voice heard with your team/organization. 2. Advocacy as a leadership tool, examining ways to champion both your own contributions & the success of others, creating space for diverse perspectives. 3. Overcoming challenges unique to underrepresented groups in tech, including navigating implicit biases, breaking through communication barriers, & leading effectively Agenda 6:00 PM - ReceptionCheck into the event, & enjoy food & drinks while networking with other engineering leaders. 6:30 PM - Lightning TalksEngage with two short 15 minute presentations on the event topic by: - Christine Choi - Senior Staff Data Scientist @ LinkedIn- Nitya Shekar - Executive Coach & Founder of Second Wind Group 7:25 PM - Panel Discussion + Live Q&ADeep dive into the topic of the event & direct your live questions to: - Christine Choi - Senior Staff Data Scientist @ LinkedIn- Nitya Shekar - Executive Coach & Founder of Second Wind Group- Yannie Yip - Engineering Manager @ Asana- Jin Zhang - Director of Engineering @ Meta Moderated by: - Siri Kostanyan - Co-organizer @ Engineering Leadership NYC MC'ed by: - Alegria Baquero - Engineering Manager @ Zocdoc 8:10 PM - NetworkingMake new connections & continue the discussion with fellow leaders until 8:30pm. About Engineering Leadership NYC Engineering Leadership NYC is a community for Engineering Managers, Directors, VPs, & Staff+ Engineers working in the software industry. The organization hosts in-person events focused on fostering connections, sharing experiences, & building professional relationships. Through curated topics, panel discussions, & networking opportunities, we provide a space for leaders to navigate the challenges of engineering management & leadership together. About LinkedIn Founded in 2003, LinkedIn connects the world's professionals to make them more productive & successful. With more than 1 billion members worldwide, including executives from every Fortune 500 company, LinkedIn is the world's largest professional network. The company has a diversified business model with revenue coming from Talent Solutions, Marketing Solutions, Sales Solutions & Premium Subscriptions products. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, LinkedIn has offices across the globe. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com. Attendee Confirmation Principles To ensure fairness, relevance of the event, & transparency in our RSVP approval process, we follow these principles when confirming event attendees: 1.  Relevance of BackgroundWe will prioritize applicants with an engineering leadership role & experience that align with the mission of our community and/or are relevant to the topic of the event. 2. Prior Event Attendee PriorityIf space is limited, existing community members who have attended our prior events will be prioritized over new applicants. 3. First-Come, First-ServedOtherwise, RSVPs will generally be confirmed in the order they are received. Thank you for your understanding!

events.name: Health Innovation Summit

Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Navigating New Cyber Landscape - Impact Of Agentic AI
events.description: The rise of agentic AI is fundamentally reshaping enterprise security, creating both opportunities & challenges as organizations navigate this evolving landscape. While AI agents offer powerful capabilities for automation, threat detection, & response, they also introduce new attack vectors & supply chain vulnerabilities. This transformation raises critical questions about the future of infrastructure-potentially shifting from cloud-centric to hybrid models-and the role of AI in protective security measures. Join AWS, Evolution Equity, SYN Ventures, & BoldStart in exploring these critical implications & learn how leading organizations are leveraging AI to transform their security strategies while managing emerging risks. Registration Information: Due to high demand & limited capacity, submitting a registration does not guarantee entry. All RSVPs will be reviewed & approved on a weekly basis, with confirmation emails being sent to approvals.

events.name: A11yNYC - Celebrating 35 Years Of People & Tech
events.description: This event will be online & in-person. The speaker & YouTube live stream starts at 7:30 pm ET. In-person attendees may arrive as early as 7 pm ET. Important note We're gathering in a special location to celebrate 35 years of people & technology. It will be held at Civic Hall at Craig Newmark Auditorium, 2nd Floor, Civic Hall  The Bernard Goldstein Center. 124 East 14th Street, New York, NY 10003. Description We're working on having multiple speakers give lightning talks. Stay tuned! If you'd like to apply to give a lightning talk (5 to 10 minutes), fill out this form. Accessibility The presentation will have human captions [CC], not automatic captions. There will be an ASL interpreter. For Aira Visual Interpreter access for the Blind & Low Vision community, download the Aira Explorer app on the Apple App Store or Google Play. For access in the physical space, the A11yNYC geofence should apply automatically. To access the online webinar for audio description, use the A11yNYC Access Offer to call, or simply inform your Visual Interpreter that you'd like that offer applied when you connect. Please let us know about any other accessibility requirements two weeks before the event. Livestream Link coming soon Provided by Internet Society Accessibility SIG. Location details The Craig Newmark Auditorium is situated on the 2nd floor of Civic Hall. Upon entering the building, please proceed to the elevators, which provide direct access to the 2nd floor. For security purposes, all attendees may be required to check in at the reception desk in the lobby before proceeding. Transportation options Civic Hall is located near several public transportation options:  Subway: 4, 5, 6, L, N, Q, R, W Trains: Union Square Station is approximately 100 feet from the venue. Bus: M14A/D, M1, M2, M3, M55: These bus lines have stops in the vicinity of Union Square, providing easy access to the venue.  Accessibility  Union Square Station is equipped with elevators & is fully accessible. The building entrance at 124 East 14th Street is ADA-compliant, ensuring convenient access for all attendees.  Parking While street parking is limited, there are several parking garages nearby for those who prefer to drive. Ride-sharing services Cabs & ride-sharing services can drop passengers off directly at the building entrance on East 14th Street. Accreditation All A11yNYC meetups are pre-approved for IAAP Continuing Accessibility Education Credits (CAEC). Sponsors Thanks to AKQA, Deque, Evinced, Equal Entry, & Fable for sponsoring. Want to be a sponsor? Contact meryl@equalentry.com

events.name: SaaS Founders & Investors Happy Hour
events.description: NachoNacho - The B2B SaaS & AI + Services Marketplace, ZenDesk for Startups, Deel, Morrison Foerster, & Plug & Play are hosting this exclusive Founder + Investor happy hour event alongside key high-profile brands & VC firms. This networking event will be exclusively for SaaS & AI Founders (minimum $1MLN raised), C-Suites, investors, tech media, & tech leaders (partnership leaders are definitely welcome, too). This event will include sponsored drinks & include a rooftop deck component. This is the premier networking event for New York Tech Week.  At New York Tech Week last year, we had an amazing turnout with hundreds of participating investors & Founders. You can see photos from our New York Tech Week event here (https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7204146057440628738) to get an idea of what it was like. We've also done regular networking events for Founders in the New York City area.  We want everyone to have genuine conversations & build real connections here where founders can share their vision, investors can find the next great startup investment opportunity, & media members can get an inside track of the latest deals & tech trends. Thanks to our sponsors! Deel: Deel is an HR software that allows businesses to easily expand their workforce globally. With Deel, you can start hiring employees & contractors abroad while they take all the liability & handle compliance matters for you. Learn more at https://nachonacho.com/product/deel Zendesk for Startups: Zendesk helps startups build better customer service through interactions powered by advanced AI, enabling founders to scale before growing headcount. The best part? You'll get six months free, & its super easy to set up in no time. Learn more at https://nachonacho.com/product/deal-zendesk. MoFo: 170+ ECVC lawyers across 18 global offices advising 2,000+ startups, VCs, & tech-focused clients. We offer full-service supportfrom formation to financings, M&A, & IPOstailored to market conditions. We deliver strategic, end-to-end counsel to help emerging companies grow & succeed. Learn more at http://mofo.com. Plug & Play: The ultimate innovation platform. Our mission is to build the world's leading innovation platform & make innovation open to anyone, anywhere. We do this by connecting entrepreneurs, corporations, & investors worldwide.Learn more at https://www.plugandplaytechcenter.com. Supermomos:Join 20,000+ other tech, business, & finance professionals in NYC by being a part of the Supermomos community. Supermomos is a tech start-up that facilitates curated in-person communities & brings together like-minded professionals to make friends & exchange ideas. The Knowledge Shop: Thefounder community in New York. We prioritiserelationship building over superficial small talk - by bringing folks together at in-person events, & between times, encouraging conversations on our approval-only WhatsApp group. Learn more at https://www.theknowledge.shop. If you're interested in sponsoring, please reach out to andy@nachonacho.com. This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com. By attending this event, you agree to receive a one-time marketing email or text from NachoNacho & its partners with information related to the event & exclusive offers.

This networking event will be exclusively for SaaS & AI Founders (minimum $1MLN raised), C-Suites, investors, tech media, & tech leaders (partnership leaders are definitely welcome, too). This event will include sponsored drinks & include a rooftop deck component. This is the premier networking event for New York Tech Week.  At New York Tech Week last year, we had an amazing turnout with hundreds of participating investors & Founders. You can see photos from our New York Tech Week event here (https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7204146057440628738) to get an idea of what it was like. We've also done regular networking events for Founders in the New York City area.  We want everyone to have genuine conversations & build real connections here where founders can share their vision, investors can find the next great startup investment opportunity, & media members can get an inside track of the latest deals & tech trends. Thanks to our sponsors! Deel: Deel is an HR software that allows businesses to easily expand their workforce globally. With Deel, you can start hiring employees & contractors abroad while they take all the liability & handle compliance matters for you. Learn more at https://nachonacho.com/product/deel Zendesk for Startups: Zendesk helps startups build better customer service through interactions powered by advanced AI, enabling founders to scale before growing headcount. The best part? You'll get six months free, & its super easy to set up in no time. Learn more at https://nachonacho.com/product/deal-zendesk. MoFo: 170+ ECVC lawyers across 18 global offices advising 2,000+ startups, VCs, & tech-focused clients. We offer full-service supportfrom formation to financings, M&A, & IPOstailored to market conditions. We deliver strategic, end-to-end counsel to help emerging companies grow & succeed. Learn more at http://mofo.com. Plug & Play: The ultimate innovation platform. Our mission is to build the world's leading innovation platform & make innovation open to anyone, anywhere. We do this by connecting entrepreneurs, corporations, & investors worldwide.Learn more at https://www.plugandplaytechcenter.com. Supermomos:Join 20,000+ other tech, business, & finance professionals in NYC by being a part of the Supermomos community. Supermomos is a tech start-up that facilitates curated in-person communities & brings together like-minded professionals to make friends & exchange ideas. The Knowledge Shop: Thefounder community in New York. We prioritiserelationship building over superficial small talk - by bringing folks together at in-person events, & between times, encouraging conversations on our approval-only WhatsApp group. Learn more at https://www.theknowledge.shop. If you're interested in sponsoring, please reach out to andy@nachonacho.com. This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com. By attending this event, you agree to receive a one-time marketing email or text from NachoNacho & its partners with information related to the event & exclusive offers.

events.name: AI Founders - The Good, The Bad, The Unknown
events.description: Join us for a candid & inspiring panel discussion at our AI Founders Panel: The Good, The Bad, The Unknown. This unique session brings together visionary founders who are navigating the unprecedented AI revolution happening right now. Our panelists will share their personal stories of building AI companies during this transformative period, discussing both the extraordinary opportunities & distinctive challenges of founding an AI venture in today's rapidly evolving landscape. Attendees will gain rare insights into how these founders are making real-time decisions amid shifting technological capabilities, regulatory environments, & market dynamics. Whether you're building your own AI startup, considering entering the space, or simply fascinated by how entrepreneurs are shaping this technological revolution, this panel offers a window into the minds of those writing the history of AI entrepreneurship as we speak. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from founders who are actively defining what it means to build AI companies during one of the most significant technological transitions of our lifetime. Our Event Agenda: 17:00-17:15 - Welcome & Introduction of Panelists Host: Dr.Nick Gu, Applied AI TL, Android, Google 17:15-18:30 - Panel Discussion: Navigating Current AI Landscape for Founders - Speaker (Pending): Joseph Varghese, Founder, 3dayai/Success Circle- Speaker: Trista Van Tine, Founder, Nunchi AI, Michigan Tech Week- Speaker: Andrew Hoh, Co-Founder, LastMile AIMore to come! 18:30-19:00 - Open Q&A with Audience This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.description: Bagel Breakfast & Panel Discussion: 'Navigating international expansion - setting yourself up for success & avoiding common mistakes' Are you ready take on the world?  If you have. 	Landed your first customer overseas,	Made plans to launch your product on an international market,	Raised funding & are ready to expand your business to overseas markets,	Started considering your first overseas hire, then this session is for you! Led by international law firm Taylor Wessing & UK Government's Department for Business & Trade, we will discuss best practices & common mistakes when expanding your company & sales internationally, drawing on extensive experience of helping 100's of US-based technology-led companies on their international expansion. This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. events.name: Venture Salon
events.description: Venture Salon is a private gathering for early-stage & growth-focused founders & investors, thoughtfully hosted by Yorkseed & In Pulse. Designed as a high-signal alternative to traditional networking events, this exclusive evening will welcome 100 handpicked guests - including AI founders, emerging fund managers, researchers, & ecosystem leaders - for a night centered on connection, curation, & conversation. It offers a refined space for candid dialogue, strategic alignment, & meaningful relationship-building among those actively shaping the next wave of innovation. No pitches. No panels. Just curated connections & shared ambition. This edition of Venture Salon takes place during NY Tech Week, bringing together some of the city's most forward-thinking voices for an evening of impactful exchange. Who Should Attend Startup founders (pre-seed to Series A & beyond) Investors: Angels, VCs, LPs, family offices, private equity, accelerators, & corporates Attendance is limited & subject to approval. Our Hosts & PartnersYorkseed Yorkseed is a premier global venture ecosystem connecting visionary founders, strategic investors, & ecosystem leaders. Born from a grassroots community, it now fosters purposeful connections & sustainable growth across diverse tech sectors worldwide. Whether you're building the next breakthrough or backing tomorrow's leaders, Yorkseed is your gateway to meaningful partnerships & transformative opportunities. Subscribe to our weekly mailing list: https://yorkseed.beehiiv.com Join our global hubs: https://yorkseed.co/#about In Pulse In Pulse is a global community of AI leaders & professionals, connecting experts, developers, founders, & investors. We shape future technologies, share expertise, & foster connections to accelerate business growth. From AI engineering to generative art, our ecosystem brings together researchers, scientists, data specialists, creatives, & artists. Engage with AI influencers, thought leaders, & industry pioneers. Whether you're innovating or exploring transformative opportunities, In Pulse is your gateway to meaningful collaboration & the forefront of AI advancement. Subscribe to our community: https://inpulse.events/#subscription Discover more: https://inpulse.events

Whether you're a first-timer or just looking to unwind, our classes are the perfect way to have fun, recharge, & meet new people during Tech Week. 10:00 - 11:00 - 10 folks11:30 - 12:30 - 10 folks1:00 - 2:00 - 10 folks2:30 - 3:30 - 10 folks4:00 - 5:00 - 10 folks Make sure you share the time you would like to attend! events.name: Shaping The Experiential Economy
events.description: In this era of hyper digitalization, we see a parallel, seemingly paradoxical consumer demand for real-life experiences.  This dichotomy actually makes a lot of sense.  The more our lives move online & our interactions get mediated by machines, the more we miss & crave physical interactions with other humans & the world around us. This is why we are so excited to bring a unique panel of founders building in the experiential economy space to Tech Week to discuss what they are building, current trends, pitfalls & opportunities in the space, & where they see the space going in the next decade.  We will not only discuss trends in direct-to-consumer experiences but also cover how various businesses have excelled in using IRL opportunities for customer activation or employee retention.   We will also discuss what it's like to fundraise in the space.  The night will end with time for networking with others passionate about the IRL Renaissance happening today. PANELISTS: Radha Agrawal: Co-founder & CEO of Daybreaker, the global morning dance, music & wellness movement with a community of half a million people. Radha is also an angel investor in mostly female owned businesses. Justin Bolognino: Pioneer in immersive experiences that fuse technology, design, & human connection. As the founder of META & Unreality, Justin & his team have crafted multi-sensory experiences for Spotify, Google, & Samsung in collaboration with artists like St. Vincent & Skrillex for Coachella & SXSW. Virginia Frischkorn: Founder & CEO of Partytrick, a software platform revolutionizing how experiences are planned, executed, & scaled through smart design & data-driven insights. Prior to Partytrick, Virginia spent 15 years as a luxury events planner & was recognized by Vogue & Martha Stewart Weddings as one of the top 50 planners in the world. If you have any questions for the panelists, please send them in your RSVP & we will try to get to as many as we can at the end of the panel.  Please email shanna@bookkaria.com if you have any questions about the event. Hosted by Karia, a platform that curates & executes elevated guest activities for our partner hotels & resorts.  Offerings include sound bathing, sourdough making, watercolor, mixology, & cacao ceremony under the stars.  Reach out to us inquiry@bookkaria.com. This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Building AI Startups
events.description: Join Mucker Capital for a panel discussion on how early-stage founders are applying AI to solve real problems - not just talk about hype. You'll hear practical insights & behind-the-scenes stories from startup leaders who are integrating AI into their products, processes, & decision-making. From experimentation to execution, learn what's working, what's not, & what's next. Confirmed panelists include: - Dan Cleary, Co-founder & CEO at PromptHub- Rock Vitale, Founder & CEO at Easie- Zhou Yu, Co-founder at Arklex- Aahad Patel, Investor & Chief of Staff at Mucker Capital (moderator) Whether you're building with AI or just starting to explore it, this session is designed to share practical insights & lessons learned from those that are doing it. Stick around after the session for food, drinks, & networking. Note:This session is designed for B2B startup founders. Space is limited, & preference will be given to early-stage founders. Final location details will be shared upon approval. Sponsored by Amplitude & Remote. By submitting this form, you agree to receive communications from Mucker & sponsors. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. events.name: ROI Of Clean Code
events.description: Business CasualDrinks & SnacksSoftware shapes the world - & it shapes your business. As software becomes more critical to business strategy, the systems behind it are under pressure & the long-term cost of unsustainable code is mounting.  ABOUT THE EVENTJoin leaders from JPMorgan Chase, the London Stock Exchange Group, a16z, OWASP, & Software Improvement Group (SIG) for an insight-packed session on how sustainable software is becoming a key driver of business resilience, scale, & innovation. You'll hear from technical, strategic, & policy voices on how to:  Define & measure software sustainability in real terms Align C-suite vision with development execution Shift quality left in the development lifecycle Navigate GenAI's long-term impact on software practices Leverage sustainable systems as a competitive & compliance advantage  WHO IS THIS EVENT FOR?Designed for both engineering & business leaders, this session combines real-world insights with strategic foresight - & features key findings from SIG's upcoming State of Software 2025 report, including industry-specific benchmarks.  AGENDA3:00 PM - Arrival & Welcome 3:30 PM - Opening Remarks & 2025 Industry InsightsLuc Brandts, CEO, SIG 3:40 PM - Keynote | Sustainable Software Engineering: From Intention to ExecutionPepijn Senders, Head of Innovation, SIG 4:10 PM - Panel DiscussionSpeakers from LSEG, JPMorgan Chase, a16z, OWASP, & SIG Engineering, business, & policy perspectives on software sustainability 4:30 PM - Audience Q&A 4:45 PM - Snacks, Drinks & Networking Whether you own the roadmap or the revenue, this conversation will reshape how you think about software's role in driving growth.  For more information, visit www.softwareimprovementgroup.com This event is part of #NYTechWeek - a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Happy Hour w/ QUAY & Morgan Stanley
events.description: QUAY Acceleration & Morgan Stanley Inclusive & Sustainable Ventures Lab (MSISVL) are excited to host a Happy Hour to connect founders, investors & major ecosystem players of the NYC tech ecosystem during NY #TechWeek, following the success of last year's event. Whether you are a #founder looking to learn more about MSISV, an #investor looking for the next groundbreaking idea to invest in, or a relevant #ecosystem player wishing to get involved with brilliant founders, we invite you to join us for a night filled with meaningful conversations while overseeing the Manhattan skyline, sipping drinks & grazing tasty bites. Spots are limited so please register at your earliest convenience if you wish to attend. We look forward to seeing you there! Please note: by registering, you acknowledge that photos & videos may be taken by the event organizers. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com. About Morgan Stanley Inclusive & Sustainable Ventures Lab (MSISV):Morgan Stanley Inclusive & Sustainable Ventures Lab provides early-stage startups with access to capital & resources to help them develop & scale. The mission is to foster a more equitable & sustainable investment landscape. Learn more at https://morganstanley.com/ventures. About QUAY Acceleration:QUAY Acceleration (previously WEVE Acceleration & Cela Innovation) supports US & international economic development groups to generate business outcomes through our accelerator programs. Our goal is to assist innovators in exploring new markets & achieving business growth by providing exceptional knowledge, connections, & resources. We collaborate with a network of public & private partners to deliver customized programs for startups across the globe. Learn more at https://www.quay.co/

events.name: Latino Founders & Investors Mixer
events.description: Join us for an exclusive speed dating event designed for Latino founders from the US & Latin America, hosted at Google. This unique networking opportunity is co-hosted by Colectivo, Pygma, & Dux, bringing together a dynamic community of entrepreneurs & General Partners (GPs) to forge powerful connections & explore potential collaborations. Whether you're seeking funding, partnerships, or just looking to expand your network, this event provides the perfect platform to meet face-to-face with top investors & industry leaders who are particularly interested in the growth & success of Latino-founded startups. Engage in rapid-fire meetings, gain insights, & discuss potential pathways to accelerate your business growth. Highlights: Speed networking sessions are tailored to facilitate meaningful exchanges. Opportunities to connect with a curated list of investors & business leaders. A collaborative atmosphere is fostered by Google's innovative spirit. _______________________ Want to be part of our Tech Radar? We're spotlighting the movers & builders shaping the future of Latino tech - & we'd love to include you. Whether you're a founder, GP, or LP, this is your moment to shine during Latino Tech Week. Are you a founder raising capital? Tell us about it here Are you a GP investing or fundraising? We wanna hear from you Are you an LP investing in the next wave? Join the radar Are you a startup & want to pitch at our competition? Apply here This event is a part of #NYTechWeek & #LatinoTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem with a focus on Latinos in Tech.

events.name: Health2Tech
events.description: Health2Tech - a series of digital health events.Join us on June 3rd for an exclusive gathering that brings together the brightest minds in the digital health space. Hosted by Alex Koshykov, this evening promises to be a confluence of innovation, inspiration, & invaluable networking.  Event Schedule: 5:30 PM - 6:00 Doors Open. Begin the evening with a warm welcome & a chance to settle in. 6:00 - 6:35 "Catalyzing Change: Building Effective Startup-Enterprise Alliances to Transform Care" by Austin Chiang.  6:35 - 8:30 Networking. Connect, converse, & collaborate with peers driven by a common passion for advancing healthcare through technology.  About our Guest Speaker:Dr. Chiang is an interventional gastroenterologist & the inaugural Chief Medical Officer of the Endoscopy arm of Medtronic, the global medical technology & device leader while also maintaining his clinical practice as an Assistant Professor of Medicine at a teaching hospital in Philadelphia. He completed his undergraduate degree at Duke University, earned his MD from Columbia University, & trained in Internal Medicine at New York Presbyterian Hospital. He further specialized in GI & bariatric endoscopy at Brigham & Women's Hospital, obtaining an MPH from Harvard TH Chan School of Public Health & finishing with an advanced endoscopy fellowship at Jefferson Health. A prominent advocate for patient education, Dr. Chiang is influential on social media, with over 700,000 followers & 180 million views across platforms like Instagram, TikTok, & YouTube. He has a strong background in social media research, previously serving as Chief Medical Social Media Officer at Jefferson Health & as the founding president of the Association for Healthcare Social Media. In 2021 he was GLAAD Media Award nominee & in 2024 he was named among MM+Ms Healthcare Marketing Influencer Top 25. He has spoken at significant events such as SXSW & Aspen Ideas: Health, & his work has been highlighted by major media outlets. He sits on the inaugural YouTube Health Advisory Board & ,in 2022, joined the White House Healthcare Leaders in Social Media Roundtable.  In April 2024, Dr. Chiang published "Gut: An Owners Guide" (DK/Penguin Random House), an illustrated book aimed at educating the public on gut health & gastroenterological innovations.  Why Attend? Meet like-minded individuals who are actively shaping the health tech landscape. Share experiences, discuss challenges, & explore potential solutions with fellow founders. Learn from the journeys of other entrepreneurs, discover something new, seek advice, & perhaps find the mentor or partner you've been looking for.  Who Should Attend? Digital Health Founders at various stages of their startup journey. Healthcare Professionals who are passionate about health innovation. Investors looking to make impactful contributions to the digital health & medtech spaces.  Why Is This Event A Must? Hear from thought leaders & innovators in the digital health domain (at every event, we'll have a new set of speakers). Connect with peers, potential collaborators, & mentors. Participate in engaging Q&As & discussions that can spark new ideas & opportunities.  Venue Details: Great location in the heart of New York, equipped to foster conversations & connections. Venue details will be shared with registered attendees. Because of limited capacity, we won't be able to accommodate everyone, so please register whenever you are sure you can attend. Dont miss this chance to be part of a community thats driving the future of health tech. Reserve your spot now & join us in shaping the landscape of digital health for 2025 & beyond. Partners FINN Partners - more than an agency. Champions of change. FINN Partners is one of the fastest-growing global, independent marketing & communications agencies in the world, serving clients through a powerful combination of bold creativity, informed strategy, hands-on partnership, & highly specialized expertise. About the organizer Alex Koshykov is a co-founder of BeKey & a digital health expert who constantly shares news, introduces promising technologies, & promotes secured software & hardware for the healthcare industry on his YouTube channel. Additionally, he is a co-founder of YODD, a medical device startup. Additional Information By signing up, your email will be automatically added to the Health2Tech newsletter with news & upcoming events  but dont worry, we wont flood your inbox! ;) Also, just a note that this event might be photographed or filmed. If we do capture some moments, Health2Tech may use the photos or videos for marketing & communication purposes. By registering, you're giving us the thumbs up for using your image for these reasons. This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Ai-Native Product Development Workshop
events.description: Are you ready to unlock the full potential of AI for your product? Join Codewalla & Startup Grind at The Yard: Herald Square for an exclusive workshop during #NYTechWeek that will revolutionize how you think about product development in the AI era. In just two hours, you'll gain: Cutting-edge strategies for AI-native product design Practical frameworks to integrate AI into your existing products Insights from industry experts on leveraging AI for competitive advantage Who Should Attend: Startup founders Product managers Innovation teams Technical & non-technical entrepreneurs Whether you're building your first AI-powered product, looking to refresh an existing offering, or exploring how AI can transform your business, this workshop is your roadmap to staying ahead in the rapidly evolving tech landscape. Limited seats available - don't miss this opportunity to future-proof your product strategy!

events.name: Fundraising w/ AI
events.description: Presented by Finta, The Capital Copilot Join us for Fundraising with AI during NY Tech Week - a hands-on session exploring how the next generation of AI tools is transforming startup fundraising. Discover how AI agents like Aurora are streamlining outreach, personalizing investor engagement, & automating deal workflows for founders & fund managers. Whether you're raising your first round or scaling a fund, this event will showcase practical AI-powered strategies to accelerate your capital raise & stay ahead of the curve.  Our Featured Speakers: Avi Yaschin,Founder & CEO, Subconscious AICausal market research, at GPT speed.Avi has built a platform that delivers human-grade market insights faster, cheaper, & more ethically than traditional firms-backed by PhD-level rigor & real-time language models. He'll share how he raised capital for Subconscious AI & how his customers (Fortune 500 & top-tier VCs) wield those insights to underwrite investments. Kevin Siskar,Founder & CEO, Finta"Capital Copilot automating $500M+ in deal flow."Former Managing Director of Founder Institute NYC & longtime earlystage investor, Kevin leads Finta's mission to unlock capital access for all. He'll share playbooks & insights that have helped founders close rounds 2 faster.   What You'll Walk Away WithA playbook for integrating AI agents into your raise (email templates, tool stack, KPI benchmarks). A shortlist of investor databases & model prompts that actually surface warm intros. Fresh connections with NYC operators, VCs, & technologists building the next gen of fundraising infrastructure.   Schedule:Welcome: 6pmPanel: 6:30pm - 7:30pmMixer / Social: 7:30pm - 9pm This event will provide actionable insights into what it takes to raise capital at each stage, the challenges founders face, & how to strategically position your company for success. Whether you're in the process of raising your first round or preparing for your next stage of growth, this event is designed to equip you with the knowledge & confidence to move forward. Co-Hosted by Subconscious AICo-Hosted by Future Communities Capital This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Marketplace Startups
events.description: Tackling the Cold Start Problem is the single biggest challenge facing marketplace founders-how do you build both sides (buyers & sellers) at the same time & keep them coming back? Join us for a raw, no-BS conversation about the good, the bad, & the ugly of launching & scaling two-sided platforms.  What You'll Learn: Real Solutions to the Cold Start Problem : Learn actionable ways to jumpstart supply & demand simultaneously in 2025.  Customer Engagement & Retention: Battle-tested strategies to convert early adopters into loyal, long-term users.  Organic Growth Strategies: Proven tactics to transform early traction into a vibrant, self-sustaining community.  Unfiltered Insights & Hard Lessons: Raw stories about the failures that led to success-no sugar-coating.  Who's on the PanelPanelists: TBD - Founder & Investor lineup to be announced soon. Moderator: Conor Lyden, CEO of TrustapFounder & Chief Executive Officer of Trustap, an award winning Irish Fintech startup with a specific focus on enabling users to buy & sell online with complete peace of mind.  Who Else Is Going Early-stage to mid-stage marketplace founders hungry for growthMarketplace investors scouting the next big thing  Product/tech teams tackling two-sided network challenges  Anyone aiming to build trust, growth, & revenue in a marketplace model  Why You Should Attend Tried-and-True Tactics: Hear exactly how seasoned entrepreneurs overcame the cold start & kept their platform thriving.  A Playbook for 2025: Get strategies that work in today's hyper-competitive landscape-user acquisition, monetization, brand building.  Network with Real Movers: Forge meaningful connections with marketplace experts, potential partners, or even future co-founders.  No-Sugar-Coating Allowed: Ugly Talk is about real stories, real mistakes, & real breakthroughs.  Co-Hosted With: Trustap - an end-to-end transaction solution that seamlessly integrates payments, fulfilment & support into your marketplace or ecommerce store.  GREY Journal - Media partner spotlighting modern entrepreneurs (Apple News + Google News)  About Ugly TalkStarted in 2019, Ugly Talk has been turning business breakdowns into breakthroughs through unfiltered events featuring real-world founders. We've built a community across NYC, Chicago, San Francisco, & Miami - creating thousands of real connections, real lessons, & real results. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: AI In Recruiting - But At What Cost?
events.description: In this panel discussion, Brett Martin will lead a group of expert founders & HR executives from leading scaleups & Fortune 500 companies as they explore the tradeoffs of introducing AI into the recruiting process. Together, theyll seek to answer the question: Can efficacy, efficiency, & the candidate experience all be improved by deploying AIor must sacrifices be made? Expert Panel:- Moderator: Brett Martin, Cofounder @ Fonzi AI & General Partner @ Charge Ventures- Panelist: Lisa Moore, Chief People Officer @ Yahoo- Panelist: Stacy Johnson Robnett, VP, Talent @ Lightspeed Venture Partners- Panelist: To Be Announced, Head of Talent @ Unicorn Company This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. events.name: Artificially Un-Intelligent - Tech Themed Comedy Show
events.description: Leave your jira tickets open, term sheets unfilled, & SaaS unscaled for the best night of tech-themed stand up comedy you didn't know you needed. Artificially Un-Intelligent is the flagship event of Tech Week - where tech & comedy collide. Presented by Puzzle, Vanta, & Ramp. This isn't your typical networking night. We're bringing the energy, the laughs, & the connections to a whole new level with a one-of-a-kind Stand-Up Comedy Show featuring SWE, PM, Founders, & VC comedians seen on Netflix, Tech Roast Show, NPR, Comedy Central, Morning Brew, & more! "Why come?" is the wrong question to ask - let's break it down: - We're taking over Broadway Comedy Club, one of New York City's iconic hotspots, located in the heart of the city. - We're gathering the best founders, builders, & investors - expect high-energy networking with the people shaping the future. - Top comedians who regularly sell out shows across the country will bring the energy (and the laughs). - Zero boring panels - just a great show, real conversations, & meaningful connections. Enough listening. It's time to start talking. Agenda:6:00 - 7:00 PM | Networking, snacks, & drinks 7:00 - 7:15 PM | Welcome remarks from co-hosts7:15 - 8:15 PM | Live stand-up comedy show8:15 - 9:00 PM | After-show connections (the best part) Come for the laughs. Stay for the people. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

DETAILS



Leave your jira tickets open, term sheets unfilled, & SaaS unscaled for the best night of tech-themed stand up comedy you didn't know you needed. Artificially Un-Intelligent is the flagship event of Tech Week - where tech & comedy collide. Presented by Puzzle, Vanta, & Ramp. This isn't your typical networking night. We're bringing the energy, the laughs, & the connections to a whole new level with a one-of-a-kind Stand-Up Comedy Show featuring SWE, PM, Founders, & VC comedians seen on Netflix, Tech Roast Show, NPR, Comedy Central, Morning Brew, & more! "Why come?" is the wrong question to ask - let's break it down: - We're taking over Broadway Comedy Club, one of New York City's iconic hotspots, located in the heart of the city. - We're gathering the best founders, builders, & investors - expect high-energy networking with the people shaping the future. - Top comedians who regularly sell out shows across the country will bring the energy (and the laughs). - Zero boring panels - just a great show, real conversations, & meaningful connections. Enough listening. It's time to start talking. Agenda:6:00 - 7:00 PM | Networking, snacks, & drinks 7:00 - 7:15 PM | Welcome remarks from co-hosts7:15 - 8:15 PM | Live stand-up comedy show8:15 - 9:00 PM | After-show connections (the best part) Come for the laughs. Stay for the people. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Early Investors Coffee Hour & VC Data Presentation
events.description: Antler & Harmonic are back with their annual NYTW morning mixer for NYC's early stage investors. We'll be featuring a VC data presentation in the middle. 8:30 - 9:20: coffee & "hey good to see yous"9:20 - 9:50: VC data presentation by Harmonic9:50 - 10:30: more coffee & deal flow Serving Joe's Coffee Company cold brews & espressos onsite About Antler VCAntler works with founders through our signature founder residency, adding value immediately, & taking no equity up front. Founders have the opportunity to pitch our Investment Committee to receive a $200k investment for 8%, allowing them to build for 12-18 months rather than attempting to raise before they have real traction. Apply at antler.co/us About HarmonicHarmonic is the startup discovery platform trusted by teams at NEA, Bedrock, Craft (and more) to find breakout investments. Harmonic provides market intelligence on 20M+ startups with tools designed to create better deal flow. Find your next deal on Harmonic  harmonic.ai ** By registering, you acknowledge that photography & videography will be produced at the event, which may be distributed & shared on social media at our discretion (no names will be publicly shown). Please reach out should you have any questions! This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Live:The Room Podcast w/ Partiful
events.description: Since its launch in 2022, The Room has hosted flagship events at tech weeks across the country. This year, in partnership with Season 12 sponsors Mercury & Perkins Coie, Madison & Claudia will record a live episode featuring an interview with Shreya Murthy, CEO & co-founder of Partiful. Following the show, attendees will have the chance to connect with other founders & investors during a cocktail reception. About The Room PodcastThe Room Podcast is a top technology podcast founded in 2020 with the mission of opening the door to the room where it happens. Co-hosts Madison McIlwain & Claudia Laurie have have had over 110 conversations across 12 seasons which have included Sridhar Ramaswamy, the visionary behind Neeva & the latest CEO of Snowflake; Cristobal Valenzuela, the driving force of Runway ML; Guillermo Rauch, the mastermind of Next.js & Vercel; & Michelle Zatlyn, co-founder & COO of Cloudflare & more. They were named to the Forbes 30 under 30 list in media & are ranked in the top 10% of technology podcasts. Season 12 Sponsors About MercuryMercury is the fintech ambitious companies use for banking*, credit cards, & software to power all their financial workflows. Mercury began with the belief that all ambitious founders deserve the products to operate at their best. To do this, we started with the one thing every business needs - the bank account. With powerful banking at the center of their financial operations, more than 200K companies gain the precision, control, & speed they need to operate at their best. To learn more, visit mercury.com. *Mercury is a financial technology company, not a bank. Banking services provided by Choice Financial Group, Column, N.A., & Evolve Bank & Trust, Members FDIC. About Perkins CoiePerkins Coie's Emerging Companies & Venture Capital lawyers are trusted advisors to the world's most innovative companies & most visionary investors. We support startup clients from formation to exit with comprehensive legal & business counseling. Our clients have raised more than $15 billion in the private markets over the past three years between the pre-seed & growth stage. Our extensive corporate law experience, combined with sector-specific business & product counseling, ensure our services are tailored to each client's unique needs, investor expectations, & growth trajectories in cutting-edge industries like AI, aerospace & defense tech, fintech, digital health, gaming, energy innovation, digital media, & consumer packaged goods. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek - a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com. The event hosts & sponsors may use the personal information we collect from & about you for business purposes such as sending newsletters, updates, & other communications we think will be of interest to you, including about our services, programming, & events unless you have opted out of such communications.
