events.name: Venture Roadtrip
events.description: VENTURE ROADTRIP USA: THE ONLY NYC TECH WEEK EVENT WORTH THE MILEAGE Bored of the same coastal echo chambers? Put your networking GPS on "adventure mode" & merge onto something completely different!  FASTEN YOUR SEATBELTS: WE'RE TAKING THE ROAD LESS VENTURE-D  Daring Ventures invites you to ditch the Silicon Valley traffic jam & join us for a cross-country expedition to the beating heart of America's overlooked tech hubs. No compass necessary-just bring your appetite for disruption & authentic BBQ! WHY STAY IN YOUR LANE when you can swerve into the fast-growing tech scenes beyond the coasts? Our all-star lineup of non-coastal VCs will be your tour guides through the technological landmarks you've been missing: Columbus, OH - Where innovation doesn't require an ocean view Milwaukee, WI - Brewing up startups that'll make you say "cheese!" Atlanta, GA - Where startups rise faster than the summer heat Austin, TX - Where your funding round comes with a side of queso PANELISTS: Christy Johnson (Fireroad Ventures) Jennifer Abele (VC 414) William Leonard (Valor Ventures) Anish Zut (Drive Capital) FUEL UP with a mouthwatering spread of authentic regional delicacies that'll make your typical catered NYC event seem like a sad highway rest stop vending machine. WARNING: Attending other Tech Week events after ours may cause severe withdrawal symptoms. Side effects include constantly mentioning "this amazing founder from Wisconsin" & unconsciously calculating how your funding would stretch 3x further in Kansas City. THE SCENIC ROUTE IS THE ONLY ROUTE: In one night, you'll meet more genuine innovators than in a week of standard NYC elevator pitches. We promise fewer PowerPoints & more powerful connections. DRESS CODE: Highway chic (coastal elite outfits will be politely tolerated) Pack light, but bring plenty of business cards-this is one roadtrip where you'll actually want to pick up hitchhikers. RSVP before we leave you in the dust! SHOUT OUT TO OUR ROADTRIP COMPANIONS Rova Partners Startups often face fragmented financial systems, limited visibility, & the urgent need to become investor-ready. These challenges are compounded by operational complexity & evolving business needs. Rova provides comprehensive support across accounting, strategic finance, & operations. We design & implement reliable systems, establish clear financial processes, & develop investor-ready reporting infrastructure. By connecting finance & operations, we help founders gain financial visibility, improve decision-making, & build a foundation for sustainable growth. From early growth through major transactions, we bring precision & structure to every stage of the journey.   Offit Kurman Offit Kurman is a full-service Am Law 200 firm with more than 280 attorneys providing comprehensive legal counsel across 30+ practice areas. Since its founding in 1987, the firm has served dynamic businesses, individuals, & families-helping them maximize business value & protect personal wealth through innovative, entrepreneurial legal solutions. The firm is distinguished by the quality, breadth & global reach of its legal services & a unique operational structure that encourages a culture of collaboration. For more information, visit https://www.offitkurman.com.  Victor Balladares, a Principal at Offit Kurman, is thrilled to join New York Tech Week as a proud sponsor of the exclusive "NYTW Kickoff & Networking Mixer", bringing together visionary tech founders, influential investors, & industry leaders. With extensive experience advising funds, entrepreneurs, & disruptors navigating complex business & legal challenges, Victor fosters connections that drive innovation forward. At this year's event, Victor proudly sponsors an exclusive gathering uniting leading tech founders & influential venture capitalists, offering unparalleled networking opportunities in an engaging atmosphere filled with interactive displays & immersive technology experiences.

events.name: Building More w/ Less - Startup Building In An Uncertain Economy
events.description: Join AWS Startups & Diversity VC at New York Tech Week for: Building More with Less: Startup Success in an Uncertain Economy In today's volatile market, how can startups thrive with limited resources? How can VCs best support founders, especially those from underrepresented backgrounds? Our event brings together successful investors, GPs, & LPs to share their strategies for navigating the current economic landscape. You'll gain: Insights on securing capital & talent in a competitive marketStrategies for supporting underrepresented foundersTips for optimizing resources & driving successNetworking opportunities to connect with industry leadersWho You'll Meet Join an exclusive community of venture capital leaders, GPs, LPs, & innovative founders from diverse backgrounds who are actively engaged in fundraising & investing. This carefully curated gathering connects decision-makers who are currently raising capital, deploying investments, or seeking strategic partnerships in the startup ecosystem. Don't miss this chance to learn from those who are excelling despite market challenges & to expand your professional network. Agenda 9:00 PM GMT+5:30 Registration with food & beverage 9:30 PM GMT+5:30 Networking lunch with facilitated discussion topics 10:00 PM GMT+5:30 Panel discussion 11:00 PM GMT+5:30 Open discussion & networking

events.name: AI x Finance Happy Hour
events.description: Join V7 & Andrew Yeung for an exclusive AI x Finance Happy Hour, bringing together the boldest minds shaping the future of tech & capital. We're curating a private gathering of 100 Finance Leaders, AI founders, fintech innovators, top investors, & influential voices for cocktails & light bites. Meet fellow leaders pushing the edge & actually implementing AI - hear real stories behind the hype & connect with other early adopters. Capacity is limited & invitations are non-transferable. ABOUT OUR HOSTS:V7 is an AI company headquartered in London with over $50 million raised & 80 strong team. With V7 Go we're building practical agentic automation for high-stakes verticals. Specifically built for teams in document heavy industries - think Financial Services, Insurance & Real Estate - V7 Go is helping companies deploy AI agents that automate intricate workflows like underwriting, due diligence, claims processing, & more. Today, V7 Go is used by some of the world's largest companies in financial services, insurance, healthcare & private markets. Andrew Yeung is the founder of Fibe (a portfolio of events companies including Andrew's Mixers, The Junto Series, & Lumos House). He is also a Partner at Next Wave NYC, a pre-seed/seed fund backed by Flybridge Capital. Andrew's hosted 100+ events for 30k+ tech founders & professionals in 8 cities that were featured in Bloomberg, Business Insider, Fast Company, & Fortune Magazine. Business Insider dubbed him the "Gatsby of Silicon Alley." This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Future Of AI - Healthcare & Wellness
events.description: Manifesting a Better Future: AI x Healthcare & Wellness  Join us for an exploration on how AI is transforming healthcare & wellness, & empowering individuals to shape a healthier, more mindful future. This event will begin with a panel featuring founders building the future of healthcare & wellness backed by a16z, General Catalyst, & other notable investors.    Following the panel, attendees will engage in a creative mixer with a choice between creating vision boards, oil pastel painting, watercoloring, or friendship bracelets. Our creative mixer creates an environment where founders & investors can connect authentically while exploring the intersection of technology & wellbeing. Featuring:Amy Wu - Founder of Manifest Dani Van de Sande - Founder of the Artist & the MachineDylan Gambardella - Founder of Different Health Patrick Gilligan - Founder of Somethings Shauna Sweeney - Founder of tendercareElan Halpern & Kiki Couchman - Founders Beny Yogurt Presented by Manifest:Manifest is a Gen Z mental health community building emotional wellness through daily AI challenges that transform self-care into a rewarding & habitual experience. Backed by a16z Speedrun, STVL, HF0, Soma Capital, & others. To learn more about Manifest, visit: https://www.manifestapp.xyz/ About Artist & the MachineArtist & the Machine is the go-to destination for AI & Creativity. Known for the inaugural AI & Creativity Summit in NY & soon in LA, AATM unites pioneering founders, enterprise leaders, & artists shaping the future of human-machine collaboration.artistandthemachine.com@artistandthemachine About Different HealthDifferent Health is a high performance healthcare company delivering clinical-grade care directly to elite workplaces, arming high performers with precise data & personalized strategies to stay sharper, stronger, & ahead of the curve. We replace guesswork with actionable insighthelping companies cultivate peak-performing talent & helping individuals build bodies that keep up with their ambition. Learn more at: http://differenthealth.com/ About SomethingsSomethings is a telehealth platform that connects high-risk teens with 20-28 year old Certified Peer Specialist Mentors & Clinical Providers to drive higher engagement & avoid unnecessary behavioral health spend. About tendercaretendercare is a technology platform transforming how families care for aging parents. It frees valuable time & energy, reduces stress, & provides peace of mind by bringing the tools, services, & resources needed to support mom & dad, all in one place. It is the go-to solution for any member of the sandwich generation juggling work, life, & parenthood while assisting an aging parent. events.name: Building Capitol - AI Startups Political Advocacy Luncheon
events.description: Join AWS Public Policy at New York Tech Week for:Building Capitol: AI Startups Political Advocacy Luncheon  For too long, startups & entrepreneurs have been shut out of the rooms where innovation policy gets made. At AWS, we believe that startups & small businesses are not just key drivers of economic growth-they embody the spirit of American exceptionalism. Your insights, challenges, & experiences should play a defining role in shaping the policies that will determine the future of innovation in the U.S. & beyond. At AWS, we recognize our responsibility to help elevate the voices of startups in these critical discussions. We are committed to working alongside the startups that build on AWS to ensure their perspectives are heard. Through partnerships, direct engagement, & advocacy, we are helping connect startups with policymakers, ensuring that their insights inform the decisions that shape the technology landscape. You'll gain: Insights on the DC tech policy state of play.Strategies for talking to lawmakers to build regulations for startups, by startups.Networking opportunities to connect with industry & AWS public policy leaders.Don't miss this chance to expand your professional network & raise political capital.Registration Information: Due to high demand & limited capacity, submitting a registration does not guarantee entry. All RSVPs will be reviewed & approved on a weekly basis, with confirmation emails being sent to approvals. Agenda 9:00 PM GMT+5:30 Registration & Networking 9:30 PM GMT+5:30 Welcome Remarks 9:45 PM GMT+5:30 Lunch & Roundtable Discussion Topics 11:00 PM GMT+5:30 Open Discussion & Networking

events.name: What VCs Want, But Accelerators Dont Teach You
events.description: In this expert session from York Effect - in partnership with Startup Grind - we'll break down what most accelerators miss: the real-world marketing insights every startup needs to attract their ideal customer, avoid wasted spend, & stand out in a crowded, noisy market. Marketing Essentials That Set You On The Right Path From Pre-Seed To Series A. Most founders leave accelerators with a pitch deck, a prototype, & a lot of pressure to grow - but little clarity on how to gain customers, validate their messaging, or build traction that impresses VCs. We're teaching you how to fill that gap. In this expert session from York Effect - in partnership with Startup Grind - we'll break down what most accelerators miss: the real-world marketing insights every startup needs to attract their ideal customer, avoid wasted spend, & stand out in a crowded, noisy market. This event is perfect for: Early-stage startup founders (Pre-Seed through Series A)Teams in accelerators, venture fellowships, or university entrepreneurship programsAnyone looking to build a smarter go-to-market strategy & increase investor confidenceYou will learn: 1. Brand: Clarifying your vision, mission, & values in a way that builds trust & sets you apartHow to position yourself for investors & customers from Day 12. Customer Discovery: Understanding intent & human behavior to identify your Right Now CustomerHow to build marketing & product strategies around demand signals3. Channels & Traction: Where to market when you don't have money to waste How to create credibility, validation, & traction investors want to seeWhy founders must own the early-stage marketing story - & how to do itJoin us & get a practical, strategic foundation so you can approach marketing with the tactical understanding needed to attract users, generate revenue, & satisfy investor expectations - instead of relying on trial-and-error or burning through capital. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Harnessing AI To Craft Winning B2C Mktg Campaigns
events.description: Join us for an exclusive panel discussion where we'll dive into the transformative power of artificial intelligence in B2C marketing, showcasing how top growth marketers leverage cutting-edge AI tools to optimize strategies, enhance personalization, & boost ROI. The panel discussion will explore how AI can help you:  Craft targeted messaging for your paid campaigns that captures attention & delivers measurable results Unlock the power of personalization in your campaigns to drive explosive growth Create operational efficiencies, freeing up time to focus on the tasks that matter most Stick around after the panel to connect with peers, exchange insights, & enjoy drinks & appetizers at our happy hour. Your Speakers: Katie Freiberg, Investor Operating Partner, Right Side Up Oskar Serrander, Co-Founder, Wondercraft Kassy Edwards, Sr. Director of Retention & Marketing, Public Rec & KafeneVincent Mario Chiclacos, Director of Acquisition & Advocacy, The Farmer's Dog Mark Fiske, Operating Partner - Marketing & Digital Transformation, GenAI Co-Lead, H.I.G. events.name: Franchise Mixer
events.description: Franchising is the most powerful & overlooked wealth building engine in the USA (check out this WSJ post on Stealthy Wealthy). We are bringing together the most innovative brands, real franchisees, aspiring operators & investors for rapid pitches followed by networking.  User Uploaded ImageIf you're interested in independent business ownership & cash-flowing businesses, join us. Presenters: Chick-fil-A: an iconic franchise looking for a new wave of corporate leaders to become owner-operators. Current franchisees include ex-employees from Google, J.P.Morgan, Goldman Sachs, Amazon, etc. Area 2 Farms: an indoor, vertical farm franchise that grows & delivers fresh, local, organic, vibrant & delicious produce.  User Uploaded ImageBamb: dessert drink chain that specializes in ch & boba tea, 70+ locations in the USA & internationally Authority Brands: a national home services platform with licensed, in-demand services & strong recurring revenue. The pitch will be focused on trades trio: Benjamin Franklin Plumbing, Mister Sparky Electric, & One Hour Heating & Air.  Special Guests: Henry Anderson: Stanford grad, 9 year NFL alum turned Playa Bowls franchisee  User Uploaded ImageRichard Snow: Franchise Lending VP & Franchisee  User Uploaded ImageBobby Okereke: Stanford grad, NY Giants Captain & Linebacker  User Uploaded ImageDr. Dereck L Faulkner: NFL alum, 2x NFLPA NYNJ President  User Uploaded ImageThe rundown of the show: 6:00-6:15 PM: Networking 6:15-6:25 PM: Why Franchising 6:25- 7:30 PM: 5 Pitches with Q&A after each presentation 7:30-8 PM: Networking Free drinks & snacks served. Event attendees qualify for a free franchise consultation with our team. *This event is a part of the Owner-Operator Franchise Tour. Learn more here: https://tour.wefranch.com/

events.name: Investher Roundtables
events.description: InvestHer Roundtables: Show Her The Money! Join INPINK, Stella Foundation, & Show Her The Money Film as we bring together female investors/VC leaders, founders from all backgrounds, & the tech community - for a roundtable discussion, refreshments, complimentary headshots, & more! Investors & VC leaders from various backgrounds, from early to growth/late stages, will speak on various topics. Event Schedule:2 PM - Doors Open / Show Her The Money Film Screening3:30 PM - Film Panel4 PM- InvestHer Roundtables5 PM - Mixer with DJ Loa/Happy Hour/Open Bar Open Bar courtesy of Jackson McCrea Whiskey, Owls Brew, Waterloo Sparkling, Fast Penny Spirits, For Bitter For Worse, & more! Food provided by Bareburger Show Her The Money Panel:Catherine Gray (GP Silicon Valley Women Founders Fund, Exec Prod of Show Her The Money) John Majeski (GP Silicon Valley Women Founders Fund,Associate Producer - Show Her The Money  Silvia Mah (Founder of Stella foundation, Associate Producer - Show Her The Money) Jason Hammond (Vice President & Business Partner Manager,Fidelity Private Shares) Moderator Jacquie Duval (Partner, Perkins Coie) InvestHER Roundtables/Panel: Jennifer K. Mandelbaum (Partner, Halogen Ventures) Melissa Withers (Managing Partner & Co-Founder,RevUp Capital) Evi Heilbrunn (Founder & CEO, Peach Health Ventures) Moderator Shira Yevin (Founder & CEO, Gritty In Pink) More panelists to be announced. This 21+ event is sponsored by INPINK, Stella Foundation, & Show Her The Money. Hosted by Gritty In Pink founder, Shira Yevin. Gritty In Pink is building INPINK, a global destination for hiring female freelancers, starting with the music industry. The INPINK marketplace connects the music business with a diverse community of female creators & pros. Our lead investor is Live Nation. Stella Foundation, founded in 2012, connects women founders & investors to the right resource-at the right time-in their journeys. From ideation to funding to exit, women founders & investors look to Stella for its powerful constellation of support made up of an inclusive community, courses, access to capital events, advisory services, & funding opportunities. SHOW HER THE MONEY - This is a story that's never been told. SHOW HER THE MONEY addresses how women are getting less than 2% of venture capital funding & demystifies what venture capital is. Featuring rock-star female investors who invest in diverse women entrepreneurs with innovations that will change the world, Show Her The Money reminds us that money is power & women need it to achieve true equality. Follow @grittyinpinklife on Instagram, & visit the website INPINK.com for more company info. We recommend getting there right at 2 PM movie & 4 PM for Roundtables, as we foresee this event reaching capacity. Entry will be FREE RSVP with log in to INPINK at the door. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com

events.name: Tariff Turbulence - What It Means For Risk
events.description: Agenda5:45 PM - 6:00 PM Welcoming & Opening Remarks 6:00 PM - 6:30 PM Panel: Navigating the Political Shockwaves: Tariffs, Trade Policy & Insurance  Peilin Corbanese  Rodrigo Garcia Ayala  Matan Slagter  Kevin Chen 6:30 PM - 7:45 PM Cocktails & Networking 7:45 PM End Join us for Tariff Turbulence, a fast-paced evening exploring the latest political, regulatory, & trade developments shaking the insurance & risk landscape. As new tariffs & geopolitical tensions reshape global commerce, insurers, reinsurers, & startups are grappling with emerging volatility, unpredictable supply chains, & shifting exposures.   Our expert panel will unpack what recent months have revealed, how insurers are responding, & where new opportunities & vulnerabilities may lie.   This high-energy evening will also feature open networking, great drinks, & top-tier conversation with other forward-thinking industry professionals.   Audience: Insurers, reinsurers, MGAs, brokers, InsurTech founders, policy experts, underwriters, risk officers, & the simply curious.   What to Expect: Insightful panel discussion with insurance + policy expertsDrinks + light bitesPrime networking in the heart of NYCReal talk, no fluff, & a few surprising takeawaysDiscussion Themes: The return of tariffs & their impact on underwritingDomestic vs. global supply chain exposuresPolitical risk & capital allocationClaims & coverage considerations amid regulatory uncertaintyWhere does innovation go in volatile environments?Featured SpeakersWe are bringing together an expert lineup of insurance carrier leaders, InsurTech founders, & solution provider leaders.   Peilin Corbanese Head of Marketing, Analytics, & Data Science | AAA Life Insurance Company   Rodrigo Garcia Ayala CEO & Co-Founder | Suyana   Matan Slagter CEO | Armadillo   Kevin Chen Horizon Financial | Co-Founder & CIO About InsurTechNYInsurTechNY's mission is to bring together carriers, brokers, startups, & investors to help accelerate the digital transformation of the Insurance industry in the greater New York region. We do this by facilitating new relationships & sharing insights from influencers within the industry through hosting 6 educational & networking events a year (est. every 2 months). Please visit our website, www.InsurTechNY.com for more details.   A Previous InsurTech NY EventBelow is an example of one of our bi-monthly events (Dec 5). Influencers from Carriers/Brokers such as NY Life, Prudential, & Everest Re & InsurTech startups such as Hyper Science & Livegenic & investors from IA Capital & Overlook Rock attended the event from the greater NY region & beyond.   Video: Full event on Youtube  Follow us on social media.Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/insurtechny Twitter: https://twitter.com/InsurTechNY Meetup: https://www.meetup.com/insurtechNewYork/ Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5VDD9uyFajGZsa-5u_2_ZQ   Privacy note: InsurTech NY collects your email & phone number at registration. We use your information to share news & updates about this event & future events. We also reserve the option to share your information with our event sponsors. If you wish to opt-out, please email contact@insurtechny.com.

events.name: ETA Deal Team Day
events.description: A thoughtfully designed day for Active Searchers to forge deep community connections & level up SMB Acquisition knowledge.This is not your average panel discussion or generic networking event. This is hands-on, targeted, & built to give you the edge you need to stand out with your search.  User Uploaded ImageOur goal is simple: empower you to unlock strategies, build connections, & secure the tools you need to close the deals you are actively working on. You'll hear expert insights from top voices in the ecosystem, meet with deal team experts, & build connections with fellow searchers. What to Expect:Actionable Deal StrategiesGain practical insights from top deal team partners on financial diligence, legal structuring, risk analysis, & more. Real ConnectionsConnect, collaborate, & converse with fellow Searchers who are just as driven to succeed as you are. 1:1 Access to ExpertsChat with seasoned investors & deal pros for personalized guidance tailored to your search challenges. Fuel for the DayEnjoy a catered lunch, all-day snacks, & wrap it up with a celebratory happy hour to recharge & share ideas.  PANEL LINEUP:It's rare to get this many of the right people in one room. But that's exactly what's happening.Every expert you see on the card? They're going to be there-with you, in person, ready to dig in. CIM CITY: Deal Sourcing Mastery How top Searchers are finding deals-and what's actually working right now-brokered, proprietary, CRM-driven, & human-first.Featuring:  User Uploaded ImageDennis Unrein - SMB PE Kyle Griffith - The NYBB Group Chase Murdock - Decada Group / Durable George Wellmer - Tupelo SMB   FINANCIAL DILIGENCE BREAKDOWN Real-life QofE pitfalls, what to watch for, & how to stop falling for doctored cash flow. Get it all right before you close.Featuring:  User Uploaded ImagePatrick Dichter (Moderator) - Appletree Business Services Scott McKenzie - Baker Newman Noyes Avnit Sekhon - Treewalk Consulting ESSENTIAL LEGAL STRATEGIES Deal structures, red flags, & the clauses that really cost Searchers. The legal pitfalls most Searchers don't see coming-until it's too late.  User Uploaded ImageCharlie McCarthy (Moderator) - Veteran ETA / Whiteford, Taylor & Preston LLP Joe Spina - Cullen & Dykman LLP Bill Barlow - Barlow & Williams Laura Gieseke - SMB Law Group ETA DEBT & EQUITY SOLUTIONS Lenders, investors, & an operator on SBA, equity & how to stack capital without giving up control.  User Uploaded ImageKevin Bibelhausen (Moderator) - Investor / Operator Sarah Andrews - Live Oak Bank Jared Johnson - First Internet Bank Donza Worden - Capital Pad Jordan Fliegel - Shareholder Ventures RISK & BUSINESS OPERATIONS Buying is just the beginning. People issues, back-office chaos, & what you'll wish you'd set up earlier. This panel gets real about what happens after close.  User Uploaded ImageDavid Snow (Moderator) - Search Party Podcast Tim Wear - System Six Josh Richman - NewCo Risk Josh Tyrrell - Aspen HR FROM SEARCHER TO OPERATOR No theories here. These are real stories, lessons, & battle scars from post-acquisition life.Featuring:  User Uploaded ImageRand Larsen (Moderator) - SMB Community Grania Michel - Associated Photo & Imaging Kay Azmat - The Chief Rebel Jason Pratts - Kumo Dan Jabick - Generation Ready Ready to Get in the Room?If you're actively Searching-or ready to be-this is the most valuable day you'll spend this quarter. Sign up, show up, & let's get to work.  Reserve your spot! (this will sell out).

events.name: Bedrock Agents Workshop
events.description: Join us for a hands-on introduction to AI Agents, where you will learn to optimize task automation using generative AI. This session will demonstrate how these agents leverage foundation models to interpret complex requests, integrate with your APIs & data, & execute multistep workflows seamlessly.  Key highlights:  Multi-agent Collaboration: Coordinate specialized agents under a supervisor to manage intricate processes. RAG Integration: Provide accurate, data-supported responses through retrieval-augmented generation. Configuration: Build & customize agents efficiently with straightforward instructions.   Discover practical, real-world applications & gain the skills to transform workflows with AI-powered solutions that boost efficiency & elevate user experiences. Together, let us pave the way for intelligent automation.  This event features an interactive workshopplease bring your laptop if you wish to participate in the hands-on segment. Are you prepared to advance your organizations AI capabilities? Mark your calendar for June 9, 2025! High level schedule: 2:45 - 3:00: Arrivals 3:00 - 3:20: Presentation 3:20 - 4:20: Workshop 4:20 - 4:30: Wrap up & Q&A 4:30 - 5:00: Networking Bio: Udaya Jaladi is a Solutions Architect at AWS specializing in FinTech ISV customers. With over 16 years of experience, he has extensive expertise in designing & implementing enterprise applications across Sales, Services, Financial, HR, & Payroll domains. In his current role, he partners with customers to provide strategic guidance on building well-architected, AI-powered solutions on AWS. Udaya has developed deep expertise in Generative AI & helps organizations leverage this transformative technology to drive business innovation & efficiency Important instructions  Event starts at 3:00 pm EST, but please allow at least 15 minutes for security to process registration Please ensure that your meetup profile has your full name. Both first & last name are required & we will not be able to register attendees with just abbreviations or incomplete names. There is an optional networking & Q&A event at the end of the meetup

events.name: Navigating New Cyber Landscape - Impact Of Agentic AI
events.description: The rise of agentic AI is fundamentally reshaping enterprise security, creating both opportunities & challenges as organizations navigate this evolving landscape. While AI agents offer powerful capabilities for automation, threat detection, & response, they also introduce new attack vectors & supply chain vulnerabilities. This transformation raises critical questions about the future of infrastructure-potentially shifting from cloud-centric to hybrid models-and the role of AI in protective security measures. Join AWS, Evolution Equity, SYN Ventures, & BoldStart in exploring these critical implications & learn how leading organizations are leveraging AI to transform their security strategies while managing emerging risks. Registration Information: Due to high demand & limited capacity, submitting a registration does not guarantee entry. All RSVPs will be reviewed & approved on a weekly basis, with confirmation emails being sent to approvals.

events.name: Demos & Dim Sum
events.description: A Technical Show & Tell for AI Builders Technical AI builders only: Science fair meets dim sum during NY Tech Week. Share your foundation model experiments in a collegial setting where everyone brings working code to demo. Connect with peers actively building LLMs while enjoying a traditional dim sum experience. No pitches or business networking-just practitioners showing real technical work. Space limited to maintain our high technical standards & ensure meaningful conversations. Event Details Date: During NYC Tech WeekTime: 12:00 PM (Noon)Location: Chinatown NYC (RSVP for location)Format: Interactive show & tell over dim sum cart service.The Concept: Bring Your Build Every builder must bring their laptop with something to demo-whether it's a new feature, a technical challenge you're solving, or a breakthrough your team just achieved. As the dim sum carts circle, you'll share your work with peers in an informal, science-fair style format. What Kind of Projects Should I Bring? We welcome a variety of projects at different stages: Works in Progress: Technical challenges you're actively solving that could benefit from other builders' insightsRecent Breakthroughs: New features or capabilities your team has just implementedTechnical Experiments: Side projects or experiments that demonstrate innovative approachesBehind-the-Scenes Tools: Internal tools or infrastructure that power your productIntegration Challenges: Interesting solutions to integration problems between systems or APIsAI Model Implementations: Novel implementations or fine-tuning approaches you've developedThe ideal demo is something you can show in 3-5 minutes that sparks technical conversation. It doesn't need to be polished-authentic technical challenges often lead to the most valuable discussions. Who Should Attend Exclusively for builders who: Are hands-on with their product & technologyHave something tangible to demonstrate (no slideware)Value giving & receiving technical feedback from fellow buildersWhat to Expect Interactive showcase format-every builder brings a demo, something to tinker onCasual table rotation to see what others are buildingMonitors available at each table for easier demonstrationsAuthentic dim sum dining experience with traditional cart serviceWhy Join In a sea of networking events during Tech Week, this gathering stands apart by focusing on what builders are actually building. Connect with peers who understand both the technical & business challenges you face, & form relationships based on genuine interest in each other's innovations. Space is strictly limited to 30-35. Your ticket to entry? Your laptop & something to share. Bring your build, share your challenges, & leave with meaningful connections to fellow technical builders.

events.name: AI In Action - Driving Real Impact w/ AI
events.description: NY Tech Week | In-Person | Manhattan Ready to move beyond AI experiments & actually make it work for your business? Join Proximity Works for an executive workshop designed for leaders ready to move beyond experimentation & into real-world deployment. This isn't an introduction to AI - it's a hands-on deep dive into implementing AI agents, automation, & GenAI solutions in weeks, not months. Discover how leading companies automated operations, increased output by 10x, & launched AI agents at speed. No buzzwords. Just practical, ROI-focused strategies from the team behind AI deployments at some of the world's biggest companies globally. If you're building the AI roadmap for your company, this is your room. Why Attend? AI Agents in Action: See how companies are using AI agents to automate ops, accelerate workflows, & boost output - at scale. We'll unpack real-world systems that: Reduced manual ops by 80% Increased content output by 10x Went from scope  MVP  scale in weeks, not quarters From Idea to ROI: Learn how to identify high-impact opportunities & move fast - from prototype to production. Cut Through the Noise: Understand what actually works-co-pilots, RAG, model fine-tuning, orchestration-and where to avoid the hype. Battle-Tested Strategies: Walk through real use cases that reduced manual effort by 80% & increased content output 10x. Learn from common pitfalls & uncover additional strategies gleaned from actual deployments. Network Intentionally: Connect with CXOs, founders, & product leaders who are actively investing in AI & innovation. What You'll Walk Away With 1 x AI Strategy Consultation Session with Proximity's AI Experts A clear, customized AI roadmap framework built around measurable ROI Strategic playbooks to launch AI agents across ops, content, CX, & internal workflows Clarity on GenAI, co-pilots, & orchestration tools - & how to fit them into your stack Who Should Attend Founders, CEOs, CTOs, Heads of Product, & Innovation leaders across industries - especially those with $50M-$500M in revenue, mid-to-high digital maturity, & a strong mandate to scale AI with real outcomes. About Proximity Works Born in Silicon Valley, built for real-world scale. We help brands like Disney+, ESPN, & Cars24 build & deploy applied AI-fast. Our embedded AI strike teams combine senior ML engineers, architects, & strategists to deliver MVPs in weeks & enterprise rollouts in months. No fluff, no demos-just execution that moves the needle. We build systems that move KPIs-fast. Workshop Agenda 11:00 AM - 11:15 AM: Welcome Check-in Hello & introductions Snacks & refreshments 11:15 AM - 11:30 AM: Opening Remarks Overview of Proximity Works & the AI Strategy Workshop Walkthrough of the event's theme & agenda 11:30 AM - 12:30 PM: Strategy Workshop 11:30 PM - 1:00 PM: Interactive Q&A Engage with speakers & peers on AI strategies & challenges 1:00 PM - 1:30 PM: Closing Remarks & Networking Summary of key takeaways Final thoughts & next steps Networking opportunity with fellow executives & AI experts Space is limited-register your interest today, & we'll notify you soon if your registration is approved! This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Building Emotional Support Systems w/ AI
events.description: This isn't just another tech panel-join us for an intimate, women-led roundtable exploring how AI can support emotional wellbeing, digital balance, & addiction recovery in today's high-pressure, hyperconnected world. This gathering will break into small, thoughtfully curated groups to spark honest conversations, not lectures. Together with 50 mission-driven technologists, builders, & community leaders, we'll dive deep into designing a more compassionate digital future.  Core topics we'll explore: How AI can offer non-judgmental, always-on emotional support Rethinking digital wellness & social media through a gender-inclusive lens Exploring voice vs. text agents for crisis care Designing pro-user algorithms that empower attention-not exploit it Our hosts:EchoHer is a non-profit organization dedicated to empowering women & non-binary founders & funders by increasing their representation & success in entrepreneurship. We foster a supportive ecosystem to drive meaningful change & create impactful opportunities through monthly events, co-working opportunities, curated networking sessions, pitch nights, & insightful panel discussions. PowerYou is an AI-powered companion for emotional healing & wellbeing. Designed for people navigating addiction, burnout, or self-doubt, it offers daily support through guided reflection, personalized action plans, & a warm, human-like AI guide named Kris. We imagine a world where no one has to suffer alone in their hardest moments - because the support they need is right in their pocket. Already ready to listen. Always learning. Always there. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: The State Of Venture Capital
events.description: Venture capital firms are more selective & demanding when it comes to financing these days, especially with regard to first financings by early stage startups.  Join us for an informative panel where well be discussing questions & topics such as: - When does it make sense to start approaching venture capital firms for investment?- What does it take for a startup to raise its first priced round these days?  - What are early, growth, & late stage VCs investing in today?- What kind of business & financial metrics should a founder have in place before approaching venture firms for a priced round raise, whether Series Seed or Series A/B/C?- What do venture capitalists predict about the venture market for the remainder of 2025? Panelists: - Lindsey Mignano (SSM Law)- Naomi Goez (Forum Ventures)- Daniel Fleischmann (Timber Grove)- Pramod Gosavi  (Blumberg Capital)- Kevin Ye (Mach49) Moderator:-Christina Sclafani (TriNet) Food & Beverage Sponsors: Jacquelynne Suguitan, Christina Sclafani, & Grace Power of TriNet; Gadiel Morantes of Pilot; Calina Thompson of Safra National Bank; Lindsey Mignano of SSM Law; & Garrison Gowens of Cake Equity. By registering for this event, you herein agree to SSM's Privacy Policy (https://www.ssm.legal/privacy-policy.html) & Terms of Use (https://www.ssm.legal/terms-of-use.html). This event may be attended in person (if approved) or via Zoom (https://us06web.zoom.us/j/4810347305?pwd=dDhvblA3M1JEQTN1MkkyaEpvZzVjQT09) This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Join us for an informative panel where well be discussing questions & topics such as: - When does it make sense to start approaching venture capital firms for investment?- What does it take for a startup to raise its first priced round these days?  - What are early, growth, & late stage VCs investing in today?- What kind of business & financial metrics should a founder have in place before approaching venture firms for a priced round raise, whether Series Seed or Series A/B/C?- What do venture capitalists predict about the venture market for the remainder of 2025? Panelists: - Lindsey Mignano (SSM Law)- Naomi Goez (Forum Ventures)- Daniel Fleischmann (Timber Grove)- Pramod Gosavi  (Blumberg Capital)- Kevin Ye (Mach49) Moderator:-Christina Sclafani (TriNet) Food & Beverage Sponsors: Jacquelynne Suguitan, Christina Sclafani, & Grace Power of TriNet; Gadiel Morantes of Pilot; Calina Thompson of Safra National Bank; Lindsey Mignano of SSM Law; & Garrison Gowens of Cake Equity. By registering for this event, you herein agree to SSM's Privacy Policy (https://www.ssm.legal/privacy-policy.html) & Terms of Use (https://www.ssm.legal/terms-of-use.html). This event may be attended in person (if approved) or via Zoom (https://us06web.zoom.us/j/4810347305?pwd=dDhvblA3M1JEQTN1MkkyaEpvZzVjQT09) This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. events.name: Fund Design For Mortals - Healthtech LP GP Dinner
events.description: An LP/GP Dinner hosted by MarkOne Health & sponsored by JP Morgan Healthcare Banking.nIn an era where 84% of healthcare VC exits fall below $650M & 42% fall below $150M, the pursuit of billion-dollar unicorns increasingly resembles a lottery ticket strategy.nThis dinner confronts the reality that mid-market exits ($80M$250M) now represent healthcares most replicable liquidity path. This gathering will bring together healthcare GPs & LPs for a thoughtful conversation around M&A trends, fund design, capital strategy, & alignment of LP & GP goals  & as a result better outcomes for LPs, GPs, & founders.nnTo apply to participate, you must currently be either the GP or MP of a healthtech focused fund or a current LP into the same. nnParticipation will be limited to 12 each from the LP & GP side.

events.name: Future Of Tech Talent & AI
events.description: Join us for a thought-provoking conversation on how AI is reshaping the tech workforce & what it means for the future of talent. We'll sit down with: Michelle Volberg, Founder & CEO of Twill, a hiring platform that presents companies with pre-vetted talent endorsed by professionals working at the highest levels in engineering, sales, product, marketing, ops & more. Sign up for Twill. Jen Dunnam, VP of Design at Patreon, the membership platform empowering creators to build sustainable income streams directly from their biggest fans Sairam Rajagopal, Head of Product at Guidepoint, a global platform that connects decision-makers with experts The panel will be moderated by Lori Berenberg, Investor at Bloomberg Beta Together they will explore: The evolving skillsets needed in an AI-driven landscape How founders & tech leaders are rethinking hiring, upskilling, & retention What the next generation of tech talent should be doing now to stay ahead Expect sharp insights, real examples, & actionable takeaways, designed for decision-makers leading through change. ------- About Enrich Enrich is a private network for ambitious, growth-minded leaders who want to invest in themselves. Through structured workshops, facilitated discussions, & intimate dinners, we help people make better decisions, lead more effectively, & grow in their careers. Learn more: https://joinenrich.com/ ------ About Twill Twill is a hiring platform that presents companies with pre-vetted talent endorsed by professionals working at the highest levels in engineering, sales, product, marketing, ops & more. Sign up for Twill. https://app.withtwill.com/apply #ai #nycpanel #firesidechat #nytw #newyorktechweek #techweek

events.name: Coeus Collective Pitch Showcase
events.description: Join us for an electrifying Pitch Showcase during Tech Week, presented by Seedlegals & organized by Coeus Collective, with support from J.P. Morgan Innovation Economy! If you are a FOUNDER interested in PRESENTING, start here! (If you're just interested in attending, we'd love to see you at the Showcase! Just skip the next few paragraphs.) FOUNDERS: Welcome to what is set to be a highly anticipated event this New York Tech Week. The goal of this event is a pitch showcase that promotes mentorship for early-stage founders. Pre-seed & seed-stage startups in all industries are encouraged to participate! All founders interested in presenting must fill out the four founder-specific questions in the questionnaire here on Partiful. Based off this questionnaire, a select group of founders will be selected as finalists for a mentorship round. These finalists will be presenting on June 3, & each finalist will be paired with one of the following mentors:  David S. Rose (Managing Partner, Rose Tech Ventures & Founder & Chairman Emeritus, New York Angels) Norma A. Padrn, Ph.D. (Vice President, J.P. Morgan) David Kullmann (Venture Partner, Late Stage Capital) Ren Bastn (Venture Partner, Covenant Venture Capital) David Attermann (Head of Web3 Investments, M31 Capital) We will assign mentors two weeks prior to the Showcase date at the latest. Each of these mentors have already confirmed their capability to take on mentorship of multiple teams & connect with founders to review their pitch. Selected mentors will also be serving as judges on the big pitch showcase night! FOR NON-PRESENTING ATTENDEES: Please RSVP, but no need for you to fill out the presenter-specific questions in the questionnaire of course! Whether you are a founder, investor, operator, or startup fanatic generally, we hope to see you live & in-person on Tuesday, June 3. Watch as 10-12 highly vetted startups present their companies to potential investors, corporate partners, & customers during New York Tech Week. WHAT TO EXPECT: - Dynamic startup pitches from highly-vetted emerging entrepreneurs- Networking with investors, founders, & fellow tech enthusiasts- Light refreshments, food, & an energetic start to your Tuesday evening! DISCLAIMER: This pitch showcase is designed as a supportive platform for founders to receive valuable feedback & mentorship, rather than a traditional competition. While participants will benefit from expert guidance & networking opportunities within the VC ecosystem during the Showcase & the mentorship matching process, please note that no financial awards or monetary prizes will be presented as part of this event. The value for founders lies in the connections made at the Showcase, feedback received from mentors, & the opportunity to showcase their ventures to the broader New York Tech Week community. Additionally, no offer to invest in any of the founders participating in this Showcase at any stage is being made by any of the organizers, sponsors, supporters, judges, mentors, or attendees; neither is any offer for investment being solicited from the audience at the Pitch Showcase nor any member of the broader New York Tech Week community of attendees, sponsors, & affiliates. This event is organized by Coeus Collective.  Coeus Collective is a founder-powered media & community platform elevating the most innovative minds in entrepreneurship, technology, & venture capital. Through podcasts, events, & digital media storytelling, we help founders & VCs develop their audience of builders & innovators. Past events have featured Daniel Lubetzky (KIND Bars, Shark Tank), Michael Baum (Splunk), & Siya Raj Purohit (OpenAI). The Coeus Collective Podcast is currently live on our Coeus Collective YouTube channel & all audio platforms! This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Scaling Communities To Millions + AI
events.description: Join us for an intimate fireside chat where we dive deep into the art of scaling communities from 0 to millionswith real stories, hard-earned lessons, & actionable strategies from founders whove done it themselves. Siam Hossain, founder of Algorizin, scaled his community to over 200k members & built a 7-figure revenue businesshell share his playbook, the challenges he faced, & the key decisions that made all the difference in growing his community.  Then, well bring in the power of AI with Frederike Falke, founder of NYTech AI+, wholl break down how AI can supercharge your community growth in todays fast-moving landscape. Shell share her hands-on experiences building an AI community in New York & the strategies that actually work. This isnt just theoryits real tips from people whove been in the trenches. Well talk: Community growth  how to go from zero to a thriving, engaged audience Company growth (0-1)  the make-or-break moments in the early days AIs role in scaling  how to leverage tech to grow faster & smarter Challenges & learnings  the mistakes, pivots, & wins you need to know If youre a founder or just passionate about building communities, this is your chance to ask questions, get real answers, & walk away with tactics you can use immediately. No fluffjust honest, relatable stories & the kind of insights you wont find in a generic blog post. Come for the knowledge, stay for the connections, & leave ready to build something incredible. Lets make it happen - see you there! (This is a fireside chat, so bring your curiosity & lets keep it real.) This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Influence & Advocacy For Engg Leaders
events.description: Join our Engineering Leadership NYC event, in collaboration with LinkedIn, focused on discussing the experiences of women engineering leaders. We're welcoming all engineering leaders to be part of the audience. This event will explore how engineering leaders can expand their impact by fostering relationships, advocating for themselves & others, & driving meaningful change across teams & organizations. The topic will dive deep into: How to foster influence through relationships & trust, cultivating allies & making your voice heard with your team/organization. Advocacy as a leadership tool, examining ways to champion both your own contributions & the success of others, creating space for diverse perspectives. Overcoming challenges unique to underrepresented groups in tech, including navigating implicit biases, breaking through communication barriers, & leading effectively Agenda6:00 PM - Reception Check into the event, & enjoy food & drinks while networking with other engineering leaders. 6:30 PM - Lightning Talks Engage with two short 15 minute presentations on the event topic by: Christine Choi - Senior Staff Data Scientist @ LinkedIn Nitya Shekar - Executive Coach & Founder of Second Wind Group 7:25 PM - Panel Discussion + Live Q&A Deep dive into the topic of the event & direct your live questions to: Christine Choi - Senior Staff Data Scientist @ LinkedIn Nitya Shekar - Executive Coach & Founder of Second Wind Group Yannie Yip - Engineering Manager @ Asana Jin Zhang - Director of Engineering @ Meta Moderated by: Siri Kostanyan - Co-organizer @ Engineering Leadership NYC MC'ed by: Alegria Baquero - Engineering Manager @ Zocdoc 8:10 PM - Networking Make new connections & continue the discussion with fellow leaders until 8:30pm. About Engineering Leadership NYCEngineering Leadership NYC is a community for Engineering Managers, Directors, VPs, & Staff+ Engineers working in the software industry. The organization hosts in-person events focused on fostering connections, sharing experiences, & building professional relationships. Through curated topics, panel discussions, & networking opportunities, we provide a space for leaders to navigate the challenges of engineering management & leadership together. Check out pictures of our events here. About LinkedInFounded in 2003, LinkedIn connects the world's professionals to make them more productive & successful. With more than 1 billion members worldwide, including executives from every Fortune 500 company, LinkedIn is the world's largest professional network. The company has a diversified business model with revenue coming from Talent Solutions, Marketing Solutions, Sales Solutions & Premium Subscriptions products. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, LinkedIn has offices across the globe. Attendee Confirmation PrinciplesTo ensure fairness, relevance of the event, & transparency in our RSVP approval process, we follow these principles when confirming event attendees: Relevance of BackgroundWe will prioritize applicants with an engineering leadership role & experience that align with the mission of our community and/or are relevant to the topic of the event. Prior Event Attendee PriorityIf space is limited, existing community members who have attended our prior events will be prioritized over new applicants. First-Come, First-ServedOtherwise, RSVPs will generally be confirmed in the order they are received. Thank you for your understanding!

This event will explore how engineering leaders can expand their impact by fostering relationships, advocating for themselves & others, & driving meaningful change across teams & organizations. The topic will dive deep into: How to foster influence through relationships & trust, cultivating allies & making your voice heard with your team/organization. Advocacy as a leadership tool, examining ways to champion both your own contributions & the success of others, creating space for diverse perspectives. Overcoming challenges unique to underrepresented groups in tech, including navigating implicit biases, breaking through communication barriers, & leading effectively Agenda6:00 PM - Reception Check into the event, & enjoy food & drinks while networking with other engineering leaders. 6:30 PM - Lightning Talks Engage with two short 15 minute presentations on the event topic by: Christine Choi - Senior Staff Data Scientist @ LinkedIn Nitya Shekar - Executive Coach & Founder of Second Wind Group 7:25 PM - Panel Discussion + Live Q&A Deep dive into the topic of the event & direct your live questions to: Christine Choi - Senior Staff Data Scientist @ LinkedIn Nitya Shekar - Executive Coach & Founder of Second Wind Group Yannie Yip - Engineering Manager @ Asana Jin Zhang - Director of Engineering @ Meta Moderated by: Siri Kostanyan - Co-organizer @ Engineering Leadership NYC MC'ed by: Alegria Baquero - Engineering Manager @ Zocdoc 8:10 PM - Networking Make new connections & continue the discussion with fellow leaders until 8:30pm. About Engineering Leadership NYCEngineering Leadership NYC is a community for Engineering Managers, Directors, VPs, & Staff+ Engineers working in the software industry. The organization hosts in-person events focused on fostering connections, sharing experiences, & building professional relationships. Through curated topics, panel discussions, & networking opportunities, we provide a space for leaders to navigate the challenges of engineering management & leadership together. Check out pictures of our events here. About LinkedInFounded in 2003, LinkedIn connects the world's professionals to make them more productive & successful. With more than 1 billion members worldwide, including executives from every Fortune 500 company, LinkedIn is the world's largest professional network. The company has a diversified business model with revenue coming from Talent Solutions, Marketing Solutions, Sales Solutions & Premium Subscriptions products. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, LinkedIn has offices across the globe. Attendee Confirmation PrinciplesTo ensure fairness, relevance of the event, & transparency in our RSVP approval process, we follow these principles when confirming event attendees: Relevance of BackgroundWe will prioritize applicants with an engineering leadership role & experience that align with the mission of our community and/or are relevant to the topic of the event. Prior Event Attendee PriorityIf space is limited, existing community members who have attended our prior events will be prioritized over new applicants. First-Come, First-ServedOtherwise, RSVPs will generally be confirmed in the order they are received. Thank you for your understanding!

events.name: Bytes & Bites - Early Stage B2B Kick Off Breakfast
events.description: Join us this NY #TechWeek for a morning of Coffee & Donuts, officially launching this packed week          14 (yes, you heard it!) of NYCs early-stage investors are bringing together pre seed & seed b2b founders & funders for a morning you do not want to miss. On your way to work or headed to your next event, stop by & say hi as we begin the day with friends. Let's show the world what the NYC startup scene is all about.  This event is co-hosted by 2048 Ventures, Bloomberg Beta, Contour Venture Partners, Differential Ventures, Equal Opportunity Ventures, Flybridge, Hannah Grey, Laconia Capital, MetaProp, M13, nvp capital, Stage 2 Capital, Story Ventures & Techstars.  We can't wait to meet you!  A massive thank you to our partners: Captivate Talent - helps SaaS startups hire top Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, & RevOps talent fast, with a human approach & deep SaaS expertise. Learn more at captivatetalent.com. Carta, the industry leader in equity management & valuation software, brings unparalleled expertise & innovation to the table. Designed for founders & investors like you, with over 50,000 customers, Carta leads the way in equity management, streamlining processes like cap table management & equity issuance. Leran more at carta.com. Morrison Foerster - Morrison Foerster has over 1,000 attorneys across 18 offices worldwide, with more than 170 lawyers in our Emerging Companies & Venture Capital Group advising over 2,000 startups, growth companies, & investors globally. We bring deep market insight & a full-service approach to support clients through the entire company lifecyclefrom formation & financings to M&A & IPOshelping raise over $110 billion & achieve $575 billion in exits over the past five years. Our team combines legal acumen with technical expertise across industries including technology, healthcare, consumer, AI, FinTech, & more. Learn More at mofo.com.  Rho - the business banking platform, purpose-built for startups. Learn more at rho.co. Please note - Given the demand & limited capacity, registration & approval are required for attendance! This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Claims In Motion
events.description: Claims in Motion is the next evolution in our signature event series, blending industry expertise with creative expression. Agenda5:45 PM - 6:00 PM Welcoming & Opening Remarks 6:00 PM - 6:30 PM Panel: Managing High Volume Claims with Precision 6:30 PM - 6:45 PM TED-Style Talk: Improving Claims Productivity in Life & Benefits 6:45 PM - 7:15 PM Performance: Dance to the Beat of Claims 7:15 PM - 7:45 PM Break & Networking 7:45 PM End InsurTech NY Event Details  Following the success of The Sound of Underwriting & The Art of Distribution, Claims in Motion is the next evolution in our signature event series, blending industry expertise with creative expression. This exclusive event celebrates the dynamic world of insurance claims through the artistry of dance, highlighting the rhythm, agility, & precision required to navigate today's evolving insurtech landscape. Join us for an evening where insurance innovation takes center stage, featuring thought-provoking discussions, industry-leading speakers, & captivating performances that mirror the adaptability & speed of claims processing. Whether you're a claims leader, insurtech founder, or industry innovator, this is your chance to connect with top minds while experiencing a truly unique fusion of business & art. Featured Speakers  We are bringing together an expert lineup of insurance carrier leaders, InsurTech founders, & solution provider leaders. This section will be continuously updated with new speakers. Our SponsorsThank you to our sponsors for making this event possible: If you would like to have to learn more about sponsoring our events, please email contact@insurtechny.com. Who Should Attend  Distribution: CROs, Managing Directors, VPs Analytics & Data Science: VPs, Directors, & Managers in Analytics, Data Science, & Enterprise Architecture Underwriting: CUOs, VPs, Directors, & Managers Policy Administration: VPs, Directors, & Managers InsurTech Leaders: Founders, Executives, & Innovation Leaders Investors: Managing Directors, Principals, & Associates in Corporate Venture Capital, VCs, & Angel Investors About InsurTechNY  InsurTechNY's mission is to bring together carriers, brokers, startups, & investors to help accelerate the digital transformation of the Insurance industry in the greater New York region. We do this by facilitating new relationships & sharing insights from influencers within the industry through hosting 6 educational & networking events a year (est. every 2 months). Please visit our website, www.InsurTechNY.com for more details.   A Previous InsurTech NY EventBelow is an example of one of our bi-monthly events (Dec 5). Influencers from Carriers/Brokers such as NY Life, Prudential, & Everest Re & InsurTech startups such as Hyper Science & Livegenic & investors from IA Capital & Overlook Rock attended the event from the greater NY region & beyond.   Video: Full event on Youtube Follow us on social media. Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/insurtechny Twitter: https://twitter.com/InsurTechNY Meetup: https://www.meetup.com/insurtechNewYork/ Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5VDD9uyFajGZsa-5u_2_ZQ   Privacy note: InsurTech NY collects your email & phone number at registration. We use your information to share news & updates about this event & future events. We also reserve the option to share your information with our event sponsors. If you wish to opt-out, please email contact@insurtechny.com.

events.name: Cereal Founders Breakfast
events.description: Description: Before NYC was the venture capital powerhouse it is today, Kass & Mike Lazerow built, scaled, & exited unicorns in an ecosystem that was still finding its footing. As the co-founders of Buddy Media (acq. by Salesforce for $735M) & serial investors, they've lived through NYC's transformation from an underdog to a global tech hub. Join us for a special journey from scrappy to scaled where we'll learn what it takes to build, exit, & invest in the Next Wave of NYC Tech. Join us for this intimate event that will feature a book signing of their soon to be released new book, "Shoveling $h!t: A Love Story". This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. events.name: Visions Summit
events.description: About EventVISIONS Summit: NYC - Where Culture, Commerce, & the Future Converge Join us at the Museum of Modern Art for a one-day summit exploring the forces shaping the next era of commerce. Centered on this year's theme-We Are Builders of Worlds- the VISIONS Summit will explore mythmaking, design systems, brand legacy, & narrative strategy. The content is crafted to bring a fresh perspective to the retail & eCommerce landscape, inspiring marketing, CX, & innovation professionals to think beyond best practices & engage in meaningful transformation. Programmed by the editorial team at Future Commerce, this half-day event features a curated mix of keynotes, 1-on-1 interviews, & moderated panels with culture-shaping voices across media, creative arts, brand building, & technology. Through immersive storytelling, unexpected conversations, & cultural insight, this event is where the future gets built. This one-day-only experience will be held in the Roy & Niuta Titus Theater at the Museum of Modern Art, & only 200 guests will have the opportunity to attend. Full agenda & speakers can be viewed at futurecommerce.com/visions

events.name: Startup Lean Coffee
events.description: Startup Lean Coffee is a community of over 500 founders, employees, advisors, & investors. Our sole purpose is to help each other continuously improve by sharing some of the questions, concerns, challenges, opportunities, & experiences that we have all encountered in our startup journeys.nnWe follow a Lean Coffee format: a fun, lightly facilitated meeting in which you suggest & vote on the topics that are of interest to you to build the agenda; & we discuss topics for a fixed time, voting to continue discussion or move on to the next topic after the time runs out.nnBecause our theme is startups, pretty much any topic goes! Our previous topics have varied widely, from fundraising & social equity to lean product experiments & development shops to technical co-founders & psychedelic-induced flow states.nnAll you need to bring is your attention, curiosity, & willingness to share. A light breakfast will even be provided. Oh, & don't forget to bring a photo ID & allow time to go through building security.nStartup Lean Coffee is sponsored by Foley Hoag LLP.nThis event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Open-Source NYC Computer Vision Hackathon w/ Moondream
events.description: New York never sleeps - & for 48 electrifying hours neither will you. Arm yourself with edge devices, camera modules, Moondream's lightning-fast 1 GB vision model, & whatever other hardware Jon can find on eBay (within budget). Tap directly into NYC's trove of open data - live traffic cams, 311 rodent alerts, taxi heat-maps, building blueprints - to transform every curb, crosswalk, & alleyway into a programmable canvas. We're wiring the city itself into your codebase. From flash-fire prototypes that untangle gridlock to edge-powered detectors that spotlight the city's next rat hotspot, this hackathon is your shot to prove how tiny models & civic data can make the five boroughs smarter overnight. No GPUs, no red tape, just pure hustle & open-source impact in the Big Apple  Theme - Edge Vision  NYC Open Data From curb-level transit analytics to automatic rodent recognition, teams must blend on-device inference, public datasets, & their imagination to create useful products for the urban landscape. Show how lightweight models + open data can make the city safer, cleaner, smarter, & even more New York

Hear directly from enterprise leaders at Liberty Bloom (a Liberty Global company), Genpact, & more as they share how they're implementing agentic AI in the real world, with measurable results. Join us for an unfiltered conversation about the tangible impact of AI agents across Higher Education, Healthcare, Telecom, & beyond. We'll explore how these agents are reshaping industries right now-and what their future trajectory means for you. Stay tuned for exciting announcements of our speaker lineup! Who should attend? If you're curious about how leading enterprises are using cutting-edge technology to reshape the way we work, this panel is for you. events.name: Startup Pitch Mixer
events.description: Agenda6:00 PM - 6:30 PM Registration Guests register, receive badges, & event programs. This is an opportunity for casual networking, making first connections, & preparing for the event.6:30 PM - 7:30 PM Event Kickoff & Interactive Networking Official welcome from the organizers with a brief overview of the event goals & schedule. Interactive networking helps participants set their objectives & connect with key contacts.7:40 PM - 8:20 PM Startup Pitch Session Startups present their projects to investors & experts. Each team has 5 minutes to pitch, covering the project's core idea, business model, & target market.8:20 PM - 9:00 PM Chill & Networking Participants enjoy casual conversations with investors, discuss collaborations, & exchange ideas over refreshments. Hi there! Dear Participants! Join our event in NYC Manhattan!Meet & get acquainted with Startup Founders, Business Professionals & Investors. Pitch to the audience with your project & seize your chance to dive into the world of business, technology, & venture capital.  Why You Can't-Miss It:Engage with leading experts & founders in the Tech & Business, & top investors to gain deep insights & valuable networking. This event is a must-attend for those looking to gain ideas, experience, & valuable connections.  Present Your Startup in the Tech & Business:Showcase your startup in the Tech & Business! Email your pitch deck to contact.us@startupvalley.club & seize the opportunity to impress both the audience & investors! Also, you need to fill out the application to participate as a pitcher/speaker at the event. Apply now!  We Welcome New Investors:We invite investors to our event to expand their network, get acquainted with new startups, evaluate them, provide their feedback, participate in discussions, & gain access to a database of new & promising startups from around the world. If you're interested in attending our event as an investor, please register through this link If you'd like access to a database of promising startup projects & additional benefits from Startup Valley, please fill out this application, & our team will contact you: this link Startup Presentations in the Tech & Business & Expert Evaluations:Startups from various industries, prepare for your moment of glory with a 5-minute presentation scheduled for 07:40 PM, followed by invaluable feedback from our panel of venture capitalists & angel investors. Who will you meet at the event:FoundersInvestors or VC companiesMarketers, Salespeople, Business AdvisersGame changersAI ExpertsEntrepreneurs from Europe, Asia, & the United KingdomRequirements to attendants:Neat appearanceGood mood1 drink bought at the bar (non-alcohol works too)The venue where we host our events is our partner. To continue hosting events at this location, please consider purchasing 1-2 drinks at the bar. Thank you. Time:Event time: 6:00 -9:00PM Pitch time: 7:40 -8:20 PM Join our event, & secure your ticket today!Sincerely, Startup Valley

events.name: Founder's Guide To Fractional
events.description: Sponsored by: iDelsoft What's a Fractional-and why are founders hiring them? Come for the food & drinks, stay for the insight. This interactive event gives you direct access to top Fractional execs across Product, Marketing, Finance, & more. If you're scaling a startup, this is the high-impact talent you didn't know you needed-until now. Whether you're curious, skeptical, or actively hiring part-time leaders, this event is your crash course in what fractional really means, when it makes sense, & how to make it work for your business. No pitch decks. No fluff. Just smart people & real talk.  Agenda 6:00-6:30pm - Arrival, Drinks & MingleEase in with music, light bites, & good energy.  6:30-6:45pm - Opening RemarksWe'll kick things off with a quick, founder-friendly download:  What a fractional leader is  Why this model is taking off in tech  How to make the most of the next two hours Think of it as your roadmap for navigating the night.  6:45-7:45pm - Rotating Stations: Meet the Fractionals Explore stations by function-Product, Marketing, Finance, People, Strategy, & more. Each station offers:  Real conversations with experienced fractional leaders - your chance to ask the spicy questions (like is fractional really productive?) & debunk the biggest myths  A prompt to guide the convo Move at your own pace or follow suggested rotations.  7:45-8:15pm - Group Reflection & Real TalkWe'll gather for a quick & candid debrief:  Founders: What did you learn or realize tonight?  Fractionals: What misconceptions do people still have?  Open mic for Q&A, insights, & follow-ups  8:15-8:30pm - Closing & Open MingleStick around to swap contacts, take selfies, & keep the conversation going. You never know who you'll meet or what spark will come from it. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com

Just smart people & real talk.  Agenda 6:00-6:30pm - Arrival, Drinks & MingleEase in with music, light bites, & good energy.  6:30-6:45pm - Opening RemarksWe'll kick things off with a quick, founder-friendly download:  What a fractional leader is  Why this model is taking off in tech  How to make the most of the next two hours Think of it as your roadmap for navigating the night.  6:45-7:45pm - Rotating Stations: Meet the Fractionals Explore stations by function-Product, Marketing, Finance, People, Strategy, & more. Each station offers:  Real conversations with experienced fractional leaders - your chance to ask the spicy questions (like is fractional really productive?) & debunk the biggest myths  A prompt to guide the convo Move at your own pace or follow suggested rotations.  7:45-8:15pm - Group Reflection & Real TalkWe'll gather for a quick & candid debrief:  Founders: What did you learn or realize tonight?  Fractionals: What misconceptions do people still have?  Open mic for Q&A, insights, & follow-ups  8:15-8:30pm - Closing & Open MingleStick around to swap contacts, take selfies, & keep the conversation going. You never know who you'll meet or what spark will come from it. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com

events.name: Sky-High Pitch Competition
events.description: A curated & mindful Tech Week gathering for Founders, Builders, & Believers. We're set for an experience like no other-where modern wellness meets cutting-edge tech, & Apollo Society collides with Rocket Mixer to create something extraordinary in one of the most beautiful & serene places in New York - Edge's Outdoor Deck. First off, we are going to start our morning with a guided breathwork session by Apollo Society. That's when we take a moment to relax, recharge our minds & bodies, & enjoy the stunning view of NYC! With focus sharpened, the pitch competition begins. 10 founders will deliver elevator pitches to a panel of top investors. The top three move on to a finale round, where they'll pitch again in more detail & receive deeper feedback.  The winner receives: $2,500 Draper House credit for global stays, programs, or funding opportunities Private Breakfast with top VCs, investors & cultural leaders Mito Health Biomarker Testing ($500 value) for optimized performance Lazo Premium Package: 2-year subscription, free business incorporation, & more Priority Access to future Apollo Society & Rocket Mixer events  Every attendee will receive: Full Othership Signature Experience Pass - Includes guided breathwork, sauna, & ice bath journey - a complete mind-body reset. Wellness Gifts Curated by Apollo Society partners to elevate your self-care ritual. Startup Support from Lazo: 6-month subscription to Lazo One + 50% off tax & bookkeeping services. Networking with Top Founders & Investors Priceless connections designed to inspire, elevate, & expand your journey.  Panel of Top Investors: Nicole Newman Enslein, Loeb.nyc, Sublime Communications Slava Rubin, Indiegogo, Nillion Jenn Bonine, Valhalla Capital Mike Schulte, Loeb.nyc, Great North Ventures Patrick Tsang, Chairman Tsangs Group a16z  Program Schedule 7:00 AM - Guest Check-In7:15 AM - Guided Breathwork Session7:45 AM - Light Snack & Refresh8:00 AM - Pitch Competition Kickoff8:45 AM - Highlights & Winner Announcement9:00 AM - Event Closing - Let's Keep Building!9:30 AM - Private Breakfast with Leading VCs & Investors (place to be announced) Whether you come to pitch your startup, connect with investors, or simply to be among the most intentional minds of the week - this experience is for you.
